traits.text: At the start of each of the wastrilith's turns, exposed water within 30 feet of it is befouled. Underwater, this effect lightly obscures the area until a current clears it away. Water in containers remains corrupted until it evaporates.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The wastrilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The wastrilith makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, and it uses Grasping Spout.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d12 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

special.name: Grasping Spout
special.text: The wastrilith magically launches a spout of water at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw, and it has disadvantage if it's underwater. On a failed save, it takes 22 (4d8 + 4) acid damage and is pulled up to 60 feet toward the wastrilith. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

bonusActions.name: Undertow
bonusActions.text: If the wastrilith is underwater, it causes all water within 60 feet of it to be difficult terrain for other creatures until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: Viconia has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put Viconia to sleep.

traits.name: Living Shadow
traits.text: While in dim light or darkness, Viconia has resistance to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Viconia wears a belt of giant strength (fire) and a cloak of protection and wields a +3 mace. Without the belt, her strength is 12 and her speed is reduced to 20 ft.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, Viconia has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

multiAttack.text: Viconia attacks twice with her Magic Mace and uses her Spellcasting action.

attacks.name: Magic Mace
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (1d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

special.name: Sacred Cleansing
special.text: Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within 60 feet must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 28 (8d6) fire damage plus 28 (8d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Viconia casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18): At will: dancing lights, light, sanctuary, thaumaturgy 2/day each: cure wounds, death ward, lesser restoration 1/day each: darkness, divine word, faerie fire, holy aura

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Viconia casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Misty Escape
traits.text: If the vampire drops to 0 Hit Points outside its resting place, the vampire uses Shape-Shift to become mist (no action required). If it can't use Shape-Shift, it is destroyed.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Vampire Weakness

options.name: Forbiddance
options.text: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.

options.name: Running Water
options.text: The vampire takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

options.name: Stake to the Heart
options.text: If a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire has the Incapacitated condition in its resting place, the vampire has the Paralyzed condition until the weapon is removed.

options.name: Sunlight
options.text: The vampire takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.text: The vampire has these weaknesses:

multiAttack.text: The vampire makes two Grave Strike attacks and uses Bite.

attacks.name: Grave Strike (Vampire Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 14) from one of two hands.

special.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
special.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. Failure: 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) Necrotic damage. The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to that amount. A Humanoid reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage and then buried rises the following sunset as a Vampire Spawn under the vampire's control.

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it shape-shifts into a Tiny bat (Speed 5 ft., Fly Speed 30 ft.) or a Medium cloud of mist (Speed 5 ft., Fly Speed 20 ft. [hover]), or it returns to its vampire form. Anything it is wearing transforms with it.

bonusActions.name: Charm (Recharge 5–6)
bonusActions.text: The vampire casts Charm Person, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17), and the duration is 24 hours. The Charmed target is a willing recipient of the vampire's Bite, the damage of which doesn't end the spell. When the spell ends, the target is unaware it was Charmed by the vampire.

actions.name: Deathless Strike
actions.text: The vampire moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Grave Strike attack.

spellcasting.name: Beguile
headerEntries: The vampire casts Command, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17). The vampire can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Fiendish Restoration
traits.text: If the ultroloth dies outside Gehenna, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in Gehenna.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The ultroloth has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The ultroloth uses Hypnotic Gaze and makes two Mercurial Whip attacks.

attacks.name: Mercurial Whip
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 15 ft. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) Force damage, and the ultroloth can teleport the target up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space the ultroloth can see that isn't in the air.

special.name: Hypnotic Gaze
special.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Stunned condition until the start of the ultroloth's next turn. Success: The target is immune to this ultroloth's Hypnotic Gaze for 24 hours.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The ultroloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: Alter Self, Clairvoyance, Detect Magic 1/day each: Dimension Door, Fireball (level 5 version), Wall of Fire

bonusActions.name: Fiendish Guile (Recharge 4–6)
bonusActions.text: The ultroloth casts Dispel Magic, Invisibility (self only), Misty Step, or Suggestion, requiring no Material components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ultroloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

name: Sunbird
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.text: When the sunbird dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried. The sunbird's body turns to ash, but an egg is left where the sunbird was.

traits.name: Fire Aura
traits.text: At the start of each of the sunbird's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) fire damage, and flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the sunbird or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) fire damage. The aura also sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The sunbird doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.text: The sunbird has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

multiAttack.text: The sunbird makes two talon attacks.

attacks.name: Talon
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the sunbird can't attack another target with that talon. A grappled creature takes 11 (2d10) fire damage at the start of each of the sunbird's turns.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The giant can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two attacks, using Storm Sword or Thunderbolt in any combination.

attacks.name: Storm Sword
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +14, reach 10 ft. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) Slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) Lightning damage.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +14, range 500 ft. Hit: 22 (2d12 + 9) Lightning damage, and the target has the Blinded and Deafened conditions until the start of the giant's next turn.

special.name: Lightning Storm
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder originating from a point the giant can see within 500 feet. Failure: 55 (10d10) Lightning damage. Success: Half damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18): At will: Detect Magic, Light once per day: Control Weather

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

traits.name: Out-Of-Phase Movement
traits.text: The seer can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, and its movement doesn't provoke |opportunity attacks.

multiAttack.text: The seer makes two Comet Staff or Psychic Orb attacks.

attacks.name: Comet Staff
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

attacks.name: Psychic Orb
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 120 feet, one creature. Hit: 27 (5d10) psychic damage.

special.name: Collapse Distance
special.text: The seer warps space around one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is teleported up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space the seer can see, and then each creature within 10 feet of the target's original space takes 39 (6d12) psychic damage. On a successful save, the target takes 19 (3d12) psychic damage and isn't teleported.

reactions.name: Bend Space
reactions.text: When the seer would be hit by an attack roll, it teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, exchanging positions with another star spawn it can see within 60 feet of it. The other star spawn is hit by the attack instead.

traits.name: Blurred Form
traits.text: Attack rolls against the spectral cloud are made with disadvantage unless the attacker is within 15 feet of the spectral cloud or the spectral cloud is incapacitated.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: The spectral cloud can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

multiAttack.text: The spectral cloud makes two Spectral Touch attacks.

attacks.name: Spectral Touch
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) force damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

special.name: Chilling Winds
special.text: The spectral cloud emits intensely cold wind in a 60-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 38 (7d10) cold damage and has the incapacitated condition for 1 minute. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, that creature is immune to this spectral cloud's Chilling Winds for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The skyswimmer can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The skyswimmer makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its slam.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the skyswimmer. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the skyswimmer, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the skyswimmer's turns. If the skyswimmer takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the skyswimmer must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the skyswimmer. If the skyswimmer dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Living Shadow
traits.text: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the dragon has Resistance to damage that isn't Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the dragon has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 10 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Necrotic damage.

special.name: Shadow Breath
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 60-foot Cone. Failure: 35 (10d6) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: A Humanoid reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies, and a Shadow rises from the corpse. The shadow is under the dragon's control and shares the dragon's Initiative count but acts immediately after the dragon.

bonusActions.name: Shadow Stealth
bonusActions.text: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the dragon takes the Hide action.

actions.name: Pounce
actions.text: The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.

actions.name: Veil of Shadow
actions.text: The dragon uses Shadow Stealth, and one creature of its choice that it can see within 10 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage. The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.text: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Antimagic Cone
traits.text: The beholder's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. The area works against the beholder's own eye rays.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage.

special.name: Eye Rays
special.description: The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

options.name: 6. Telekinetic Ray
options.text: If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

options.name: 9. Disintegration Ray
options.text: If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.

special.text: The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

actions.name: Eye Ray
actions.text: The beholder uses one random eye ray.

vulnerabilities.note: damage from weapons wielded by creatures under the effect of a Bless spell

traits.name: Greater Magic Resistance
traits.text: The rakshasa automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and the attack rolls of spells automatically miss it. Without the rakshasa's permission, no spell can observe the rakshasa remotely or detect its thoughts, creature type, or alignment.

traits.name: Fiendish Restoration
traits.text: If the rakshasa dies outside the Nine Hells, its body turns to ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

multiAttack.text: The rakshasa makes three Cursed Touch attacks.

attacks.name: Cursed Touch
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 19 (3d12) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target gains no benefit from finishing a Short or Long Rest.

special.name: Baleful Command
special.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 18, each enemy in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the rakshasa. Failure: 28 (8d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened and Incapacitated conditions until the start of the rakshasa's next turn.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The rakshasa casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18): At will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Disguise Self, Mage Hand, Minor Illusion 1/day each: Fly, Invisibility, Major Image, Plane Shift

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rakshasa casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The phisarazu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The phisarazu can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.text: When in contact with a web, the phisarazu knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The phisarazu ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

multiAttack.text: The phisarazu makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Scintillating Spray if available.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage, and the target has the poisoned condition until the start of the phisarazu's next turn.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) slashing damage.

special.name: Scintillating Spray
special.text: The phisarazu expels shimmering webs in a 60-foot cone. Creatures and objects in that area are outlined by the glittering webs for 1 minute, during which time they emit dim light for 10 feet and can't benefit from the invisible condition. Additionally, creatures in that area must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The phisarazu transforms into a crab, drider, or giant crab, or returns to its true form. Its game statistics, except for its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The pari has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The pari doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The pari makes three Mace attacks.

attacks.name: Mace
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) radiant damage.

special.name: Disorienting Futures
special.text: The pari attempts to flood the mind of one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself with visions of the future. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of the pari's next turn.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The pari casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19): At will: detect evil and good 2/day each: cure wounds (as a 6th-level spell), lesser restoration 1/day each: commune (as an action), dispel evil and good

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pari casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):

traits.name: Creature Sense
traits.text: The neothelid is aware of the presence of creatures within 1 mile of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The neothelid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

attacks.name: Tentacles
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be swallowed by the neothelid. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the neothelid, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the neothelid's turns.

special.name: Acid Breath
special.text: The neothelid exhales acid in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The neothelid casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: levitate 1/day each: confusion, feeblemind, telekinesis

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The neothelid casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Infernal Tack
traits.text: The narzugon wears spurs that are part of infernal tack, which allow it to summon its nightmare companion as an action.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The narzugon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The narzugon makes three Hellfire Lance attacks. It also uses Infernal Command or Terrifying Command.

attacks.name: Hellfire Lance
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) fire damage. If this damage kills a creature with a soul, the soul rises from the River Styx as a lemure in Avernus in 1d4 hours. If the creature isn't revived before then, only a wish spell or killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature's original body can restore it to life. Constructs and devils are immune to this effect.

special.name: Infernal Command
special.text: Each ally of the narzugon within 60 feet of it can't be charmed or frightened until the end of the narzugon's next turn.

special.name: Terrifying Command
special.text: Each creature within 60 feet of the narzugon that isn't a Fiend must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or become frightened of the narzugon for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that makes a successful saving throw is immune to this narzugon's Terrifying Command for 24 hours.

special.name: Healing (1/Day)
special.text: The narzugon, or one creature it touches, regains 100 hit points.

traits.name: Demonic Restoration
traits.text: If the nalfeshnee dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The nalfeshnee has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The nalfeshnee makes three Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 10 ft. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) Force damage.

special.name: Teleport
special.text: The nalfeshnee teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

bonusActions.name: Horror Nimbus
bonusActions.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation originating from the nalfeshnee. Failure: 28 (8d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition for 1 minute, until it takes damage, or until it ends its turn with the nalfeshnee out of line of sight. Success: The target is immune to this nalfeshnee's Horror Nimbus for 24 hours.

reactions.name: Pursuit

components.trigger: Another creature the nalfeshnee can see ends its move within 120 feet of the nalfeshnee.

reactions.text: Trigger: Another creature the nalfeshnee can see ends its move within 120 feet of the nalfeshnee. The nalfeshnee uses Teleport, but its destination space must be within 10 feet of the triggering creature.

attacks.name: Mace
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) radiant damage.

special.name: Corona of Beauty
special.text: Naes activates an aura of sunlight that lasts for 1 minute or until he dismisses it using an action. He emits bright light in a 60-foot-radius and dim light 30 feet beyond that. His enemies in the bright light have disadvantage on saving throws against any spell that deals fire or radiant damage.

special.name: Radiant Beauty of Sune
special.text: Naes dispels any magical darkness within 30 feet of him. Additionally, each hostile creature within 30 feet of Naes that does not have total cover must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 60 radiant damage on a failed saving throw, half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the saving throw has the blinded condition for 1 minute.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Naes casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18): At will: lesser restoration, light, sanctuary 2/day each: antilife shell, blade barrier 1/day each: divine word, mass heal

reactions.name: Hard to Kill (1/Day)
reactions.text: If Naes would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, or is subjected to an effect that would kill him instantaneously without doing damage, Naes instead drops to 1 hit point.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Naes casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

speedConditions.walk: (40 ft. in hybrid form, 50 ft. in dire wolf form)

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.text: The loup garou has advantage on attack rolls against a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.text: When the loup garou fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The loup garou regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the loup garou takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the loup garou's next turn. The loup garou dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

multiAttack.text: The loup garou makes two attacks: two with its Longsword (humanoid form) or one with its Bite and one with its Claws (dire wolf or hybrid form).

attacks.name: Bite (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with loup garou lycanthropy.

attacks.name: Claws (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Longsword (Humanoid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The loup garou polymorphs into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a Large dire wolf, or back into its true form, which appears humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Swipe
actions.text: The loup garou makes one Claws attack (dire wolf or hybrid form only) or one Longsword attack (humanoid form only).

actions.name: Mauling Pounce (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The loup garou moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks, and it can make one Claws attack (dire wolf or hybrid form only) or one Longsword attack (humanoid form only) against each creature it moves past.

actions.name: Bite (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: The loup garou changes into hybrid or dire wolf form and then makes one Bite attack.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The kraken can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The kraken's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The kraken can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: 3/day each: control weather, water breathing

multiAttack.text: The kraken makes two attacks: one with its claw and one with its tentacles.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Tentacles
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained.

special.name: Lightning Strike
special.text: The kraken hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kraken's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The kraken can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

traits.name: Acidic Secretions
traits.text: A creature that touches the kelubar or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (2d4) acid damage.

traits.name: Boundless Movement
traits.text: The kelubar ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed. It can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically remove the grappled condition from itself.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The kelubar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The kelubar makes two Bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage.

special.name: Spit Acid
special.text: The kelubar spits acid in a line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Summon Demodand (1/Day)
special.text: The kelubar has a 40 percent chance of summoning its choice of 1d2 farastu demodands or 1 kelubar demodand. A summoned demodand appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the kelubar, acts as an ally of the kelubar, and can't summon other demodands. It remains for 1 minute, until it or the kelubar dies, or until the kelubar dismisses it as an action.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The kelubar casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: invisibility (self only) 1/day each: dispel magic, scrying (as an action)

bonusActions.name: Nauseating Fog
bonusActions.text: The kelubar magically creates a cloud of greenish fog that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of itself. The cloud remains for 1 minute or until the kelubar uses this bonus action again. The cloud is heavily obscured and difficult terrain. Any creature that starts its turn in the cloud or enters the cloud for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have the poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kelubar casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: Jaheira has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put Jaheira to sleep.

multiAttack.text: Jaheira makes three Quarterstaff attacks.

attacks.name: Quarterstaff
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) thunder damage.

special.name: Cleansing Plague
special.text: Jaheira targets a creature she can see within 60 feet and causes a swarm of flying insects to cover the creature. The creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails their saving throw they are also blinded until the end of their next turn.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Jaheira casts ones of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18): At will: barkskin, druidcraft, poison spray, produce flame, shillelagh 2/day each: animal messenger, commune with nature (as an action), entangle, speak with animals 1/day each: heal, heroes' feast, stoneskin

bonusActions.name: Mighty Summons (1/Day)
bonusActions.text: Jaheira summons three CR 2 Beasts or six CR 1 Beasts. These summoned creatures have maximum hit points and the damage they inflict is considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks and damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Jaheira casts ones of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

traits.name: Confusing Burble
traits.description: The jabberwock burbles to itself unless it is incapacitated. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the jabberwock and is able to hear its burbling must make a DC 18 Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and it rolls a d4 to determine what it does during its current turn:
traits.text: The jabberwock burbles to itself unless it is incapacitated. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the jabberwock and is able to hear its burbling must make a DC 18 Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and it rolls a d4 to determine what it does during its current turn:

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the jabberwock fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The jabberwock regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the jabberwock takes slashing damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The jabberwock dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Uncanny Tracker
traits.text: The jabberwock can unerringly track any creature it has wounded in the last 24 hours, and it knows the distance and direction to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence.

multiAttack.text: The jabberwock makes two Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Fiery Gaze
special.text: Unless it is blinded, the jabberwock emits a 120-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line of fire from its eyes. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Tail Attack
actions.text: The jabberwock makes one Tail attack.

actions.name: Rend Attack (2 Actions)
actions.text: The jabberwock makes one Rend attack.

actions.name: Wing Attack (3 Actions)
actions.text: The jabberwock beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the jabberwock must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

traits.name: Aura of Overwhelming Splendor
traits.text: The high fae radiates dazzling and mollifying magic. Each creature of the high fae's choice that starts its turn within 5 feet of the high fae must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or have the charmed condition until the start of its next turn. While charmed, the creature also has the incapacitated condition.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the high fae fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The high fae has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The high fae makes two Fae Blade attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Stunning Soliloquy if available.

attacks.name: Fae Blade
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) force damage.

special.name: Stunning Soliloquy
special.text: The high fae unleashes a string of magical words. Each creature of the high fae's choice within 30 feet of itself must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The high fae casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19): At will: detect magic, prestidigitation, suggestion 1/day each: major image, zone of truth

reactions.name: Capricious Step
reactions.text: Immediately after taking damage, the high fae magically has the invisible condition and teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself. The invisibility lasts until the end of the high fae's next turn.

reactions.name: Ridicule
reactions.text: When a creature misses the high fae with an attack roll, the high fae magically mocks the creature, dealing 5 (2d4) psychic damage to the attacker.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The high fae casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.text: The hexton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Combat Ready
traits.text: The hexton has advantage on initiative rolls.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.text: If the hexton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.text: If the hexton fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The hexton makes one Pincer attack and two Tentacle attacks.

attacks.name: Pincer
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the hexton can't use this tentacle against other targets. The hexton has six tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The hexton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action) 1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

reactions.name: Counter Magic

components.target: + the spell's level). On a success, the spell fails and has no effect

reactions.text: The hexton attempts to interrupt a creature it can see that is casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, it fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, the hexton makes an Intelligence check (DC 10 + the spell's level). On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

reactions.name: Lightning Rebuke
reactions.text: When a creature within 120 feet of the hexton damages it, the hexton magically retaliates with an arc of lightning. The creature must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hexton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

traits.name: Staff of the Woodlands
traits.description: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it and grants Faldorn a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls (already factored into Faldorn's attacks). The staff has 10 charges. It regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges each dawn. Faldorn can use an action to expend 1 or more of the staff's charges to cast one of the following spells from it, with a spell save DC of 14:
traits.text: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it and grants Faldorn a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls (already factored into Faldorn's attacks). The staff has 10 charges. It regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges each dawn. Faldorn can use an action to expend 1 or more of the staff's charges to cast one of the following spells from it, with a spell save DC of 14:

multiAttack.text: Faldorn makes two Staff of the Woodlands attacks and uses Spellcasting. Or she uses Spellcasting and then Change Shape if available.

attacks.name: Staff of the Woodlands
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

special.name: Shadowlight
special.text: A beam of dim light emerges from Faldorn in a 5-foot-wide, 300-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 (6d8) radiant damage and is blinded until Faldorn's next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

special.name: Change Shape (2/Day)
special.text: Faldorn magically polymorphs into a Beast or Elemental with a challenge rating of 6 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 9 hours. Faldorn reverts to her true form if she dies or falls unconscious. She can revert to her true form using a bonus action on her turn. While in a new form, Faldorn retains her game statistics and ability to speak, but her AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and she gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that she lacks. She can cast her spells with verbal or somatic components in her new form. The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Faldorn casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18): At will: druidcraft, poison spray, shillelagh 2/day each: entangle, locate creature, speak with animals, stoneskin, tree stride, water breathing 1/day each: foresight, heal

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Faldorn casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The drow can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The drow ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

multiAttack.text: The drow makes three attacks, using Bite, Poisonous Touch, Web, or a combination of them. One attack can be replaced by a use of Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Bite (Spider Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

attacks.name: Poisonous Touch (Humanoid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (10d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Web (Spider Form Only;)
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 15 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: dancing lights, mage hand 1/day each: darkness, dispel magic, etherealness, faerie fire, fly, insect plague, invisibility

bonusActions.name: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonusActions.text: The drow magically transforms into a Large spider, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It can speak and cast spells while in spider form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying in Humanoid form melds into the spider form. It can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment. It reverts to its Humanoid form if it dies.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, it regains only 5 hit points at the start of its next turn. The troll dies only if it is hit by an attack that deals 10 or more acid or fire damage while the troll has 0 hit points.

multiAttack.text: The troll makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) slashing damage.

special.name: Whirlwind of Claws
special.text: Each creature within 10 feet of the troll must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: A devourer doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The devourer makes two Claw attacks and can use either Imprison Soul or Soul Rend, if available.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

special.name: Imprison Soul
special.text: The devourer chooses a living Humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature is teleported inside the devourer's ribcage and imprisoned there. While imprisoned in this way, the creature is restrained and has disadvantage on death saving throws. If the creature dies while imprisoned, the devourer regains 25 hit points and immediately recharges Soul Rend. Additionally, at the start of its next turn, the devourer regurgitates the slain creature as a bonus action, and the creature becomes an undead. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. If it had 3 to 5 Hit Dice, it becomes a ghoul. Otherwise, it becomes a wight. A devourer can imprison only one creature at a time.

special.name: Soul Rend
special.text: The devourer creates a vortex of life-draining energy in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Bramble Walk
traits.text: Difficult terrain composed of vegetation, such as foliage or thorns, doesn't cost the dryad extra movement.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.text: The dryad can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

multiAttack.text: The dryad makes two Poisonous Thorn attacks and one Sapping Vine attack.

attacks.name: Poisonous Thorn
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (4d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have the poisoned condition until the start of the dryad's next turn.

attacks.name: Sapping Vine
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: The target has the grappled condition (escape DC 16). Until the grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the dryad can't use the same vine on another target. A creature restrained in this way takes 13 (3d8) necrotic damage at the start of its turn.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The dryad casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: Druidcraft once per day: Dispel Magic 2/day each: Pass without Trace, Spike Growth

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dryad casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

traits.name: Inscrutable
traits.text: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The sphinx's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The sphinx makes a ram attack and two claw attacks.

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Ram Attack
actions.text: The sphinx makes one ram attack.

actions.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The sphinx magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.text: The seer can traverse through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the seer doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The seer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The seer uses Fission Staff twice, Psychedelic Orb twice, or each one once.

attacks.name: Fission Staff
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage, and the target is knocked prone.

special.name: Psychedelic Orb
special.text: The seer hurls a glimmering orb at one creature it can see within 120 of it. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage and suffer a random condition until the start of the seer's next turn. Roll a d6 for the condition: (1-2) blinded, (3-4) frightened, or (5-6) stunned.

reactions.name: Fuse Damage
reactions.text: When the seer is hit by an attack, it takes only half of the triggering damage. The first time the seer hits with a melee attack on its next turn, the target takes an extra 1d6 radiant damage.

traits.name: Limited Spell Immunity
traits.text: The golem automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of 7th level or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells always miss it.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The golem makes two attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) force damage.

attacks.name: Crystal Dart
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) force damage.

reactions.name: Spell Deflection
reactions.text: In response to a spell attack missing the golem, it causes that spell to hit another creature within 120 feet of it that it can see.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the beholder fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The beholder uses Eye Rays three times.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

special.name: Eye Rays
special.description: The beholder randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll 1d10; reroll if the beholder has already used that ray during this turn):

options.name: 1: Charm Ray
options.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 13 (3d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Charmed condition for 1 hour or until it takes damage. Success: Half damage only.

options.name: 2: Paralyzing Ray
options.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

options.name: 3: Fear Ray
options.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 14 (4d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.

options.name: 4: Slowing Ray
options.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage. Until the end of the target's next turn, the target's Speed is halved; the target can't take Reactions; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. Success: Half damage only.

options.name: 5: Enervation Ray
options.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 13 (3d8) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points. Success: Half damage only.

options.name: 6: Telekinetic Ray
options.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 16 (the target succeeds automatically if it is Gargantuan). Failure: The beholder moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction. The target has the Restrained condition until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder has the Incapacitated condition. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a tool or opening a door or container.

options.name: 7: Sleep Ray
options.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16 (the target succeeds automatically if it is a Construct or an Undead). Failure: The target has the Unconscious condition for 1 minute. The condition ends if the target takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

options.name: 8: Petrification Ray
options.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. First Failure: The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.

options.name: 9: Disintegration Ray
options.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 36 (8d8) Force damage. If the target is a nonmagical object or a creation of magical force, a 10-foot Cube of it disintegrates into dust. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 Hit Points, it disintegrates into dust.

options.name: 10: Death Ray
options.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 55 (10d10) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 Hit Points.

special.text: The beholder randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll 1d10; reroll if the beholder has already used that ray during this turn):

bonusActions.name: Antimagic Cone
bonusActions.text: The beholder's central eye emits an antimagic wave in a 150-foot Cone. Until the start of the beholder's next turn, that area acts as an Antimagic Field spell, and that area works against the beholder's own Eye Rays.

actions.name: Chomp
actions.text: The beholder makes two Bite attacks.

actions.name: Glare
actions.text: The beholder uses Eye Rays.

name: Atropal
languages: understands Celestial but utters only obscene nonsense

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The atropal has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Negative Energy Aura
traits.text: Creatures within 30 feet of the atropal can't regain hit points, and any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the atropal takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the atropal is struck by a vorpal sword, the wielder can cut the atropal's umbilical cord instead of dealing damage. If its umbilical cord is cut, the atropal loses this feature.

traits.name: Turn Resistance Aura
traits.text: The atropal and any other undead creature within 30 feet of it has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

attacks.name: Touch
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Ray of Cold
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) cold damage.

special.name: Life Drain
special.text: The atropal targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The atropal regains a number of hit points equal to half the amount of damage dealt.

special.name: Summon Wraith
special.text: The atropal summons a wraith which materializes within 30 feet of it in an unoccupied space it can see. The wraith obeys its summoner's commands and can't be controlled by any other creature. The Wraith vanishes when it drops to 0 hit points or when its summoner dies.

actions.name: Touch
actions.text: The atropal makes a touch attack.

actions.name: Ray of Cold (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The atropal uses its Ray of Cold.

actions.name: Wail (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: The atropal lets out a withering wail. Any creature within 120 feet of the atropal that can hear the wail must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The archfiend has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The archfiend uses Horror Nimbus if it can. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (5d10 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage.

special.name: Horror Nimbus
special.text: The archfiend magically emits scintillating, multicolored light. Each creature within 15 feet of the archfiend that can see the light must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the archfiend's Horror Nimbus for the next 24 hours.

special.name: Teleport
special.text: The archfiend magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

resistances.condition: while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.text: The sorrowsworn has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Rising Anger
traits.text: If another creature deals damage to the sorrowsworn, the sorrowsworn's attack rolls have advantage until the end of its next turn, and the first time it hits with a Hook attack on its next turn, the attack's target takes an extra 19 (3d12) psychic damage.

multiAttack.text: The sorrowsworn makes two Hook attacks.

attacks.name: Hook
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The altisaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The altisaur makes one Stomp attack and one Tail attack. The altisaur can't make both attacks against the same target.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 33 (7d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 22 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 45 (8d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed up to 20 feet horizontally from the altisaur.

traits.name: Ice Walk
traits.text: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, Difficult Terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 10 ft. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) Slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) Cold damage.

special.name: Cold Breath
special.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 19, each creature in a 60-foot Cone. Failure: 54 (12d8) Cold damage. Success: Half damage.

actions.name: Freezing Burst
actions.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet. Failure: 7 (2d6) Cold damage, and the target's Speed is 0 until the end of the target's next turn. Failure or Success: The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Pounce
actions.text: The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.

spellcasting.name: Frightful Presence
headerEntries: The dragon casts Fear, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14). The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

traits.name: Fabricate (1/Day)
traits.text: The dragon can cast fabricate, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

special.name: Desiccating Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales yellowish necrotic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 35 (10d6) necrotic damage and is weakened until the end of its next turn. A weakened creature has disadvantage on Strength-based ability checks and Strength saving throws, and the creature's weapon attacks that rely on Strength deal half damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't weakened.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): 1/day each: bane, control water, create or destroy water

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

bonusActions.name: Psychic Step
bonusActions.text: The dragon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: The dragon makes one Claw attack.

actions.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The dragon uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

actions.name: Essential Reduction (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: The dragon targets a creature or an object not being worn or carried that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 28 (8d6) necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it crumbles to dust.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.text: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 15-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The dragon doesn't require air.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Cold Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales a blast of frost in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) cold damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

bonusActions.name: Phase (3/Day)
bonusActions.text: The dragon becomes partially incorporeal for as long as it maintains concentration on the effect (as if concentrating on a spell). While partially incorporeal, the dragon has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail Attack
actions.text: The dragon makes one Tail attack.

actions.name: Treacherous Ice
actions.text: Magical ice covers the ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of itself. The ice, which is difficult terrain for all creatures except lunar dragons, lasts for 10 minutes or until the dragon uses this legendary action again.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) Sleep Breath or (B) Spellcasting to cast Scorching Ray.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 10 ft. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) Slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) Fire damage.

special.name: Fire Breath
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 60-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. Failure: 45 (10d8) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

special.name: Sleep Breath
special.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 60-foot Cone. Failure: The target has the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it repeats the save. Second Failure: The target has the Unconscious condition for 10 minutes. This effect ends for the target if it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: Detect Magic, Minor Illusion, Scorching Ray, Shapechange (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell), Speak with Animals 1/day each: Detect Thoughts, Control Weather

actions.name: Blazing Light
actions.text: The dragon uses Spellcasting to cast Scorching Ray.

actions.name: Pounce
actions.text: The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.

actions.name: Scorching Sands
actions.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature the dragon can see within 120 feet. Failure: 27 (6d8) Fire damage, and the target's Speed is halved until the end of its next turn. Failure or Success: The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

will: Shapechange (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell)

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The anathema has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Ophidiophobia Aura
traits.text: Any creature of the anathema's choice, other than a snake or a yuan-ti, that starts its turn within 30 feet of the anathema must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of snakes and yuan-ti. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this anathema's aura for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Six Heads
traits.text: The anathema has advantage on saves against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

multiAttack.text: The anathema makes two Claw attacks and one Flurry of Bites attack.

attacks.name: Claw (Anathema Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Flurry of Bites (Anathema Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 27 (6d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Constrict (Snake Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and it takes 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. The anathema can constrict only one creature at a time.

special.name: Spellcasting (Anathema Form Only)
special.text: The anathema casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: animal friendship (snakes only) 3/day each: darkness, entangle, fear, polymorph, suggestion

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The anathema transforms into a Huge constrictor snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Anathema Form Only)
headerEntries: The anathema casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

traits.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
traits.text: The warlord can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

traits.name: Survivor
traits.text: The warlord regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has fewer than half its hit points but at least 1 hit point.

multiAttack.text: The warlord makes two Greatsword or Short bow attacks.

attacks.name: Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Shortbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Command Ally
actions.text: The warlord targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the warlord, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Weapon Attack
actions.text: The warlord makes one Greatsword or Shortbow attack.

actions.name: Frighten Foe (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The warlord targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear it, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of warlord's next turn.

speedConditions.walk: (in one direction chosen at the start of its turn)

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons

traits.name: Devastating Roll
traits.text: The juggernaut can move through the space of a prone creature. A creature whose space the juggernaut enters for the first time on a turn must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The juggernaut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: As long as it has 1 hit point left, the juggernaut magically regains all its hit points daily at dawn. The juggernaut is destroyed and doesn't regenerate if it drops to 0 hit points.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The juggernaut deals double damage to objects and structures.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Labyrinthine Recall
