While the target is grappled this way, its speed isn't reduced, but it can't move farther from the giant. The target takes 5 (1d10) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails. The giant can grapple only one target at a time with its harpoon.

bonusActions.name: Reel In
bonusActions.text: The giant pulls the target grappled by its Harpoon up to 20 feet toward itself.

traits.name: Denizen of the Mist
traits.text: During its turn, the fog giant ignores the effects of fog cloud spells cast by it or other allied fog giants.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light 3/day each: feather fall, misty step

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two greatsword attacks and casts fog cloud.

attacks.name: Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (6d6 + 8) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Rock
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Petty Tyrant
special.text: The fog giant shouts bloodcurdling threats at the creatures that serve it. Each medium or smaller ally of the giant within 120 feet of it that can see or hear it can use its reaction to make a melee attack.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.text: The angel's weapon attacks are magical. When the angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Goldnight Menace
traits.text: As an action, an angel of Flight Goldnight can strike fear into the hearts of its enemies. Each creature of the angel's choice that is within 120 feet of it and is aware of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. The DC for this saving throw is the same as for the angel's Innate Spellcasting trait. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to that angel's Goldnight Menace for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components: At will: detect evil and good 1/day each: commune, raise dead

multiAttack.text: The angel makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Mace
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

special.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
special.text: The angel touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: The angel magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the angel's choice). In a new form, the angel retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

traits.name: Fire Blood
traits.text: Whenever a creature within 5 feet of the firegaunt hits the firegaunt with a melee attack that deals piercing or slashing damage, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

multiAttack.text: The firegaunt makes two Heated Maul attacks.

attacks.name: Heated Maul
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage. The firegaunt can cause the maul to erupt with crimson flames, and the target must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) fire damage and 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The maul can erupt with flames in this way only once per turn.

special.name: Crimson Rays
special.text: The firegaunt emits beams of fire from its eyes, mouth, and wounds in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a success or failure, that creature catches fire. Until the burning creature or another creature that can reach it takes an action to extinguish the fire, the burning creature can't regain hit points and takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The hellion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Soul Taker
traits.text: A Giant or a Humanoid that is reduced to 0 hit points by the hellion dies, and its soul rises as a lemure (see the Monster Manual) on Avernus, one of the Nine Hells, in 1d4 hours. If the creature isn't revived before then, it can be restored to life only by a wish spell or by killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature's original body.

multiAttack.text: The hellion makes two Morningstar attacks.

attacks.name: Morningstar
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the hellion's next turn.

special.name: Infernal Orb
special.text: The hellion hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the hellion can see within 120 feet of itself. The sphere spreads around corners. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 18 (4d8) fire damage and 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Boundless Movement
traits.text: The farastu ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed. It can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically remove the grappled condition from itself.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The farastu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The farastu can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without an ability check.

multiAttack.text: The farastu makes two Claw attacks and one Bite attack.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 15, with disadvantage). The farastu has two claws, each of which can grapple one creature.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit (with advantage against a creature the farastu is grappling), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 24 (7d6) acid damage.

special.name: Summon Demodand (1/Day)
special.text: The farastu has a 40 percent chance of summoning 1 farastu demodand. A summoned demodand appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the farastu, acts as an ally of the farastu, and can't summon other demodands. It remains for 1 minute, until it or the farastu dies, or until the farastu dismisses it as an action.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The farastu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability: At will: invisibility (self only) 1/day each: dispel magic, fog cloud

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The farastu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:

traits.name: Lightning Affinity
traits.text: When Eo uses Spellcasting to cast a spell that deals lightning damage, that spell deals an additional 5 damage. When Eo casts a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, she can change that damage type to lightning: acid, cold, fire, poison, thunder.

attacks.name: Twinned Orbs
attacks.text: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft., two targets. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison or thunder damage (Eo's choice).

special.name: Twinned Spell
special.text: Eo uses Spellcasting to cast banishment, dominate person, finger of death, or power word stun. This spell targets a second creature in range.

special.name: Discharge (1/Day)
special.text: Eo emits a thin green ray at a creature within 60 feet. The target must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 89 (14d6 + 40) force damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Eo casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks): At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, light, mage hand, magic missile, prestidigitation, shield, shocking grasp 2/day each: banishment, counterspell, dominate person, fireball, lightning bolt, mirror image, misty step 1/day each: chain lightning, finger of death, power word stun, teleport, wish * Eo uses wish to ensure she has a simulacrum of herself at all times.

reactions.name: Shocking Rebuke
reactions.text: As a reaction to taking damage, Eo surrounds her attacker with a coil of lightning. The target must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. It takes 16 (2d10 + 5) lightning damage on a failed save, half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Eo casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks):
footerEntries: * Eo uses wish to ensure she has a simulacrum of herself at all times.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the infiltrator fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Veiled Presence
traits.text: The infiltrator's AC includes its Wisdom modifier, and the infiltrator can't be targeted by divination magic or features that would read its mind or determine its creature type.

multiAttack.text: The infiltrator makes two Poison Blade attacks and can use Beguiling Whisper.

attacks.name: Poison Blade
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) poison damage.

special.name: Beguiling Whisper
special.text: The infiltrator magically whispers to a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or have the stunned condition due to fear or delight (the infiltrator's choice) until the end of the target's next turn, after which the target is immune to this Beguiling Whisper for 24 hours.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.text: When an attacker the infiltrator can see hits the infiltrator with an attack, the infiltrator halves the attack's damage against it.

actions.name: Cunning
actions.text: The infiltrator escapes nonmagical restraints and ends the grappled condition on itself, then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

actions.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The infiltrator makes one Poison Blade attack.

actions.name: Misdirecting Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: The infiltrator magically has the invisible condition and creates an illusory duplicate of itself in its space, then teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space within 15 feet of itself. The image flings illusory blades at two creatures of the infiltrator's choice within 20 feet of the image. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The invisibility lasts until the end of the infiltrator's next turn.

traits.name: Elemental Restoration
traits.text: If the efreeti dies outside the Elemental Plane of Fire, its body dissolves into ash, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Fire.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The efreeti has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Wishes
traits.text: The efreeti has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the efreeti knows it, the efreeti can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the efreeti can understand. If the efreeti casts the spell for the creature, the efreeti suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the efreeti has cast it three times, the efreeti can't do so again for 365 days.

multiAttack.text: The efreeti makes three attacks, using Heated Blade or Hurl Flame in any combination.

attacks.name: Heated Blade
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) Slashing damage plus 13 (2d12) Fire damage.

attacks.name: Hurl Flame
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +8, range 120 ft. Hit: 24 (7d6) Fire damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The efreeti casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: Detect Magic, Elementalism 1/day each: Gaseous Form, Invisibility, Major Image, Plane Shift, Tongues, Wall of Fire (level 7 version)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The efreeti casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the drow's darkvision.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

multiAttack.text: The drow makes three Shadow Sword attacks. One of the attacks can be replaced by a Hand Crossbow attack. The drow can also use Spellcasting to cast darkness.

attacks.name: Shadow Sword
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (7d6 + 5) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Hand Crossbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): At will: dancing lights, darkness 1/day each: faerie fire, levitate (self only)

bonusActions.name: Shadow Step
bonusActions.text: While in dim light or darkness, the drow teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

name: Dragonbone Golem
languages: understands Draconic and the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Fear Aura
traits.text: Each creature of the golem's choice that starts its turn within 20 feet of the golem must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw unless the golem is incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this golem's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The golem makes one Pinion attack and two Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Pinion
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is pinned beneath the bony pinion and restrained. The golem has two pinions, each of which can restrain one target. If a creature is restrained by one of the pinions, the golem can't attack with it. Any creature restrained by a pinion can free itself at the start of its turn with a successful DC 17 Strength (Athletics) check.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

special.name: Petrifying Breath
special.text: The golem emits a 60-foot cone of petrifying gas from its mouth. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 35 (10d6) poison damage and be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends on the target. On a failed save, the target is petrified.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.text: The dracohydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the dracohydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Reactive Heads
traits.text: For each head the dracohydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.text: While the dracohydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

multiAttack.text: The dracohydra makes as many Bite attacks as it has heads.

attacks.name: Bite

components.damageOptions: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) damage of a type chosen by the dracohydra: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

special.name: Prismatic Breath
special.text: The dracohydra's heads exhale a single breath of multicolored energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 33 (6d10) damage of a type chosen by the dracohydra: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

traits.name: Aura of Erebos
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the giant must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, or it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the giant's Aura of Erebos for 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The giant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

special.name: Noxious Gust
special.text: The giant exhales a mighty gust that creates a blast of deadly mist in a 60-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

traits.name: Elemental Restoration
traits.text: If the djinni dies outside the Elemental Plane of Air, its body dissolves into mist, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Air.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The djinni has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Wishes
traits.text: The djinni has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the djinni knows it, the djinni can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the djinni can understand. If the djinni casts the spell for the creature, the djinni suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the djinni has cast it three times, the djinni can't do so again for 365 days.

multiAttack.text: The djinni makes three attacks, using Storm Blade or Storm Bolt in any combination.

attacks.name: Storm Blade
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 feet. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Lightning damage.

attacks.name: Storm Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range 120 feet. Hit: 13 (3d8) Thunder damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

special.name: Create Whirlwind
special.text: The djinni conjures a whirlwind at a point it can see within 120 feet. The whirlwind fills a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot-high Cylinder centered on that point. The whirlwind lasts until the djinni's Concentration on it ends. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to 20 feet at the start of each of its turns. Whenever the whirlwind enters a creature's space or a creature enters the whirlwind, that creature is subjected to the following effect. Strength Saving Throw: DC 17 (a creature makes this save only once per turn, and the djinni is unaffected). Failure: While in the whirlwind, the target has the Restrained condition and moves with the whirlwind. At the start of each of its turns, the Restrained target takes 21 (6d6) Thunder damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The djinni casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: Detect Evil and Good, Detect Magic 2/day each: Create Food and Water (can create wine instead of water), Tongues, Wind Walk 1/day each: Creation, Gaseous Form, Invisibility, Major Image, Plane Shift

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The djinni casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

2e: Create Food and Water (can create wine instead of water)

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the demon's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The demon makes three melee attacks: two with its battleaxe and one with its tail. It can use Hurl Flame in place of any melee attack.

attacks.name: Battleaxe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage, or 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage if used with two hands.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or lose 10 (3d6) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an infernal wound. Each time the demon hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 10 (3d6). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

attacks.name: Hurl Flame
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The degloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The degloth makes two Razor Fist attacks.

attacks.name: Razor Fist
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target has the grappled condition (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the degloth can't use this fist to grapple another target. The degloth has two fists.

bonusActions.name: Crush
bonusActions.text: The degloth targets one creature currently grappled by it. The target must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw, taking 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The aspirant has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Marshal Undead
traits.text: Undead creatures of the aspirant's choice (excluding itself) in a 60-foot Emanation originating from it have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

multiAttack.text: The aspirant makes three Dread Blade attacks.

attacks.name: Dread Blade
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage.

special.name: Hellfire Orb
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the aspirant can see within 120 feet of itself. Failure: 21 (6d6) Fire damage plus 21 (6d6) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The aspirant casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: Phantom Steed 1/day each: Destructive Wave (Necrotic), Dispel Magic

reactions.name: Parry

components.trigger: The aspirant is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon.

reactions.text: Trigger: The aspirant is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. The aspirant adds 4 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aspirant casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Petrifying Tendrils
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn in the death embrace's space must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature is restrained. A creature restrained in this way must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failed saving throw or ending the effect on a successful one. The petrified condition lasts until the effect is ended by a greater restoration spell or similar magic.

traits.name: Reel
traits.text: At the start of each of its turns, the death embrace can pull each creature it is grappling up to 20 feet toward it (no action required).

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.text: The death embrace can breathe only underwater.

multiAttack.text: The death embrace makes two Tentacle attacks.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is also grappled (escape DC 16). The death embrace has six tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

reactions.name: Body Shield
reactions.text: When the death embrace is hit by an attack, one creature the death embrace is grappling (chosen by the death embrace) takes the damage instead.

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.text: The dao can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dao doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Elemental Restoration
traits.text: If the dao dies outside the Elemental Plane of Earth, its body dissolves into dirt, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Earth.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The dao has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Wishes
traits.text: The dao has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the dao knows it, the dao can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the dao can understand. If the dao casts the spell for the creature, the dao suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the dao has cast it three times, the dao can't do so again for 365 days.

multiAttack.text: The dao makes three Earthen Maul attacks or two Earth Burst attacks.

attacks.name: Earthen Maul
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 5 ft. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

attacks.name: Earth Burst
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +10, range 120 ft. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. Hit or Miss: Earth explodes from the target's space, creating the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 10-foot Emanation originating from and including the target. Failure: 10 (3d6) Thunder damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The dao casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: Detect Evil and Good, Detect Magic, Stone Shape 1/day each: Gaseous Form, Invisibility, Move Earth, Passwall, Plane Shift, Tongues, Wall of Stone

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dao casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

traits.name: Control Weather (8th-level Spell)
traits.text: The giant can cast the control weather spell, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two Slam attacks or two Telekinetic Strike attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

attacks.name: Telekinetic Strike
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 240 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) force damage.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: The giant magically transforms to look and feel like a Beast or a Humanoid it has seen or to return to its true form. Any equipment the giant is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. Its statistics, other than its size, don't change. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light, minor illusion 3/day each: invisibility, silent image, suggestion, tongues 1/day each: gaseous form, major image

bonusActions.name: Cloud Step
bonusActions.text: The giant teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

multiAttack.text: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 16) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

special.name: Lightning Breath
special.text: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Swallow
special.text: The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time. If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

name: Chardalyn Dragon
languages: the languages known by its creator

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest.

multiAttack.text: The dragon uses its Malevolent Presence. It then makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its tail. If the dragon isn't flying, it can also make one attack with its wings.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Wings
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d4 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Malevolent Presence
special.text: Any creature with an Intelligence of 4 or more that is within 30 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by it for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Malevolent Presence for the next 24 hours. A creature charmed in this way fixates on another creature or object that the dragon mentally chooses and must, on each of its turns, move as close as it can to that target and use its action to make a melee attack against it. If the dragon doesn't choose a target, the charmed creature can act normally on its turn.

special.name: Radiant Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales a ray of radiant energy in a 120-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

multiAttack.text: The behir makes one Bite attack and uses Constrict.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 10 ft. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) Piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) Lightning damage.

special.name: Constrict
special.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 18, one Large or smaller creature the behir can see within 5 feet. Failure: 28 (5d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. The target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 16), and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

special.name: Lightning Breath
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 90-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. Failure: 66 (12d10) Lightning damage. Success: Half damage.

bonusActions.name: Swallow
bonusActions.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, one Large or smaller creature Grappled by the behir (the behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time). Failure: The behir swallows the target, which is no longer Grappled. While swallowed, a creature has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and takes 21 (6d6) Acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.text: If the bandit is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the bandit instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

multiAttack.text: The bandit makes three attacks, using Scimitar or Pistol in any combination.

attacks.name: Scimitar
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) Poison damage.

attacks.name: Pistol
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range 30/90 ft. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) Piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) Poison damage.

bonusActions.name: Deadly Aim
bonusActions.text: The bandit gives itself Advantage on the next attack roll it makes during the current turn. If that attack hits, the target takes an extra 28 (8d6) Poison damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.text: If the balhannoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The balhannoth makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) and is moved up to 5 feet toward the balhannoth. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the balhannoth can't use this tentacle against other targets. The balhannoth has four tentacles.

actions.name: Bite
actions.text: The balhannoth makes one Bite attack against one creature it has grappled.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.text: The balhannoth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying and any creatures it has grappled, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Vanish
actions.text: The balhannoth magically becomes invisible for up to 10 minutes or until immediately after it makes an attack roll.

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The statue has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The statue's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The statue can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

multiAttack.text: The statue makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Slow
special.text: The statue targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Abyssal Rift
traits.text: If the alkilith surrounds a door, window, or similar opening continuously for 6d6 days, the opening becomes a permanent portal to a random layer of the Abyss.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.text: The alkilith can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: If the alkilith is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the alkilith move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the alkilith isn't ordinary slime or fungus.

traits.name: Foment Confusion
traits.text: Any creature that isn't a demon that starts its turn within 30 feet of the alkilith must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, or it hears a faint buzzing in its head for a moment and has disadvantage on its next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The alkilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The alkilith can climb difficult surfaces, such as upside down on ceilings, without making an ability check.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The alkilith doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The alkilith makes three Tentacle attacks.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) acid damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

special.name: Nightmare Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales a cloud of spores in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 33 (6d10) psychic damage, and it is frightened of the dragon for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Commanding Spores
actions.text: The dragon releases spores around a creature within 30 feet of it that it can see. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, or the target can't take a reaction, it takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: The dragon makes one Tail attack.

actions.name: Spore Salvo (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The dragon releases poisonous spores around a creature within 30 feet of it that it can see. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 17 (5d6) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Zendikar Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The golem makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Slow
special.text: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

special.name: Fire Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 10 ft. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Fire damage.

special.name: Fire Breath
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: 56 (16d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Weakening Breath.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 10 ft. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) Slashing damage.

special.name: Fire Breath
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: 55 (10d10) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

special.name: Weakening Breath
special.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature that isn't currently affected by this breath in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests and subtracts 3 (1d6) from its damage rolls. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The dragon turtle makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 6 (1d12) lightning damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

special.name: Steam Breath
special.text: The dragon turtle exhales steam in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

special.name: Fire Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Demonic Restoration
traits.text: If the yochlol dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points in the Abyss.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The yochlol has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The yochlol can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The yochlol ignores movement restrictions caused by webs.

multiAttack.text: The yochlol makes two Caustic Lash attacks, and it can use Spellcasting to cast Web or Dominate Person if available.

attacks.name: Caustic Lash
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +8, reach 10 ft. or range 120 ft. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) Acid damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The yochlol casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: Detect Thoughts, Gaseous Form (self only), Web once per day: Dominate Person

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The yochlol shape-shifts into a Medium Humanoid or a Medium spider or back into its true form. Its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

reactions.name: Toxic Escape

components.trigger: The yochlol is hit by an attack roll.
components.target: each creature within 5 feet of the yochlol's destination space
components.failureEffect: The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, it has the Incapacitated condition.

reactions.text: Trigger: The yochlol is hit by an attack roll. The yochlol halves the attack's damage to itself (round down), and it teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature within 5 feet of the yochlol's destination space. Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, it has the Incapacitated condition.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The yochlol casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Fey Rebirth
traits.text: If Yarnspinner dies in his Domain of Delight, he revives with all his hit points 1d4 days later in a safe location in that domain.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Yarnspinner fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: Yarnspinner can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: Yarnspinner ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

traits.name: Web Weaver (3/Day)
traits.description: Yarnspinner can take 1 minute to craft one of the following structures out of webbing:
traits.text: Yarnspinner can take 1 minute to craft one of the following structures out of webbing:

multiAttack.text: Yarnspinner makes two Bite attacks and uses Spellcasting or Web once.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) poison damage.

special.name: Web
special.text: Yarnspinner shoots webbing at one creature he can see within 120 feet of himself. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be restrained for 1 hour. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Yarnspinner casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: faerie fire, speak with animals 2/day each: animal friendship, create food and water, revivify 1/day each: awaken (as an action), pass without trace

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Yarnspinner casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

traits.name: Aura of Protection
traits.text: Xenk and his allies within 10 feet of him have advantage on saving throws.

multiAttack.text: Xenk makes three Daggersword attacks and uses Daggersword Flourish. He can replace Daggersword Flourish with Cleansing Touch if it's available.

attacks.name: Longsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 6 (1d12) radiant damage.

attacks.name: Shortsword and Dagger
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 6 (1d12) radiant damage.

special.name: Daggersword
special.text: Choose the attack that corresponds to the daggersword's current form (see Daggersword Shift below):

special.name: Daggersword Flourish
special.text: Choose the option that corresponds to the daggersword's current form (see Daggersword Shift below):

special.name: Longsword
special.text: Xenk magically detaches the longsword's blade from its hilt, launching the blade at a creature he can see within 30 feet of himself. The target must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is impaled by the blade, taking 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage, and is knocked prone. At the end of the current turn, the blade magically reattaches to its hilt.

special.name: Shortsword and Dagger
special.text: Xenk lashes out with both weapons. Each creature of his choice within 10 feet of him must make a DC 16 Dexterity throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 7 (2d6) piercing damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of Xenk's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

special.name: Cleansing Touch (1/Day)
special.text: Xenk touches a creature within 5 feet of himself. The target magically regains 27 (6d8) hit points and gains the benefit of a lesser restoration spell.

bonusActions.name: Daggersword Shift
bonusActions.text: Xenk changes the form of his daggersword, choosing one of the following forms: a longsword, or a shortsword in one hand and a dagger in the other.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sorrowful Presence
traits.text: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Sorrowful Presence for the next 24 hours.

multiAttack.text: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Longsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) slashing damage, or 5 (1d10) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) cold damage.

attacks.name: Longbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) cold damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: fog cloud, gust of wind, sleet storm

bonusActions.name: Fey Step
bonusActions.text: The eladrin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reactions.name: Frigid Rebuke
reactions.text: When the eladrin takes damage from a creature the eladrin can see within 60 feet of it, the eladrin can force that creature to make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 11 (2d10) cold damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

multiAttack.text: The warrior makes three attacks, using Greatsword or Longbow in any combination.

attacks.name: Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 19 (4d6 + 5) Slashing damage. The warrior also creates one of the following effects:

attacks.name: Longbow
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) Piercing damage, and the target's Speed decreases by 10 feet until the end of the target's next turn.

bonusActions.name: Tactical Charge
bonusActions.text: The warrior moves up to half its Speed straight toward an enemy it can see without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

reactions.name: Counterattack

components.trigger: The warrior is hit by an attack roll.

reactions.text: Trigger: The warrior is hit by an attack roll. The warrior adds 4 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss. On a miss, the warrior can make one Greatsword or Longbow attack against the attacker.

traits.name: Aura of Radiance
traits.text: The councilor magically sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The councilor can extinguish or restore this light as a bonus action. If the bright light overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell that created that darkness is dispelled.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The councilor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.text: The councilor is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy 1st level (4 slots): bless, command, create or destroy water 2nd level (3 slots): augury, calm emotions, hold person 3rd level (3 slots): daylight, dispel magic, spirit guardians 4th level (3 slots): banishment, divination, guardian of faith 5th level (2 slots): dispel evil and good, flame strike (see "Actions" below), scrying 6th level (1 slots): forbiddance, planar ally 7th level (1 slots): plane shift

multiAttack.text: The councilor makes two Radiant Touch attacks.

attacks.name: Radiant Touch
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) radiant damage.

special.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
special.text: The councilor touches another creature. The target magically regains 18 (3d8 + 5) hit points and is freed from one curse afflicting it (councilor's choice).

special.name: Flame Strike (5th-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
special.text: The councilor chooses a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 14 (4d6) fire damage and 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the councilor casts this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire damage or the radiant damage (its choice) increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

actions.name: Touch
actions.text: The councilor makes one attack with its Radiant Touch.

actions.name: Shimmering Aura (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The councilor channels positive energy into its Aura of Radiance. Until the end of the councilor's next turn, it sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Any creature that starts its turn in the bright light must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the councilor's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The councilor is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

name: Tomb Tapper
languages: understands Common and Undercommon but doesn't speak

traits.name: Petrified Death
traits.text: A tomb tapper reduced to 0 hit points turns into a lifeless stone statue. Anything it's wearing or carrying is not transformed.

traits.name: Sense Magic
traits.text: The tomb tapper senses magic within 30 feet of it and can use an action to pinpoint the location of any creature, object, or area in that range that bears magic. This sense penetrates barriers but is blocked by a thin sheet of lead.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.text: The tomb tapper can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-wide, 20-foot-tall tunnel in its wake.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The tomb tapper doesn't require air or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The tomb tapper makes two melee attacks with its sledgehammer or with its claws. If it hits the same creature with both claws, it can pull that creature within 5 feet of its mouth and make a bite attack against it.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Sledgehammer
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (6d6 + 6) bludgeoning or force damage (tomb tapper's choice). If thrown, the hammer returns to the tomb tapper at the end of its turn, landing at the tomb tapper's feet if it doesn't have a hand free to catch the weapon.

traits.name: Fire Aura
traits.text: At the start of each of the tlexolotl's turns, each creature within 10 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in that aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the tlexolotl or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.text: The tlexolotl sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The tlexolotl regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the tlexolotl takes cold damage or is immersed in water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the tlexolotl's next turn. The tlexolotl dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

multiAttack.text: The tlexolotl makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (1d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) fire damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the tlexolotl and knocked prone.

special.name: Pyroclasm
special.text: Gouts of molten lava erupt from the tlexolotl's body. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on the tlexolotl must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 21 (6d6) fire damage and 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half as much damage.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.text: At the start of its turn, the giant can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The giant deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.text: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two slam attacks. The first of those attacks that hits deals an extra 18 (4d8) damage if the giant has taken damage since its last turn.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Rock
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Fearsome Presence
traits.text: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of the eladrin for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Fearsome Presence for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks.

attacks.name: Longsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 9 (2d8) fire damage.

attacks.name: Longbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage.

bonusActions.name: Fey Step
bonusActions.text: The eladrin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.text: The eladrin adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the eladrin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Young Bronze Dragon
traits.text: Suldil is accompanied by a young bronze dragon. The dragon allows Suldil to use him as a mount.

attacks.name: Bronze Bolt
attacks.text: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) lightning damage.

special.name: Explosion (1/Day)
special.text: Suldil discharges a burst of energy in a 60-foot-radius. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) lightning damage on failed save, half as much damage on a successful save.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Suldil casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: detect magic, light, mage hand once per day: disintegrate 2/day each: counterspell, shield

bonusActions.name: Mounted
bonusActions.text: If Suldil isn't mounted, she can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto her young bronze dragon mount, provided Suldil and the young bronze dragon are on the same plane of existence. When she teleports, Suldil appears astride the young bronze dragon along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying. While mounted and not incapacitated, Suldil can't be surprised, and both her and her mount gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Suldil casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Immutable Form

traits.name: Magic Resistance

multiAttack.text: The stonecloak makes two slam attacks.
