special.name: Slow
special.text: The stonecloak targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Stone Guardian (Stone Golem)
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The stone guardian is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The stone guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The stone guardian's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The stone guardian makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Slow
special.text: The stone guardian targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Stone Golem
languages: understands Common plus two other languages but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem can't shape-shift.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The golem makes two attacks, using Slam or Force Bolt in any combination.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 5 ft. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) Force damage.

attacks.name: Force Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range 120 ft. Hit: 22 (4d10) Force damage.

bonusActions.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
bonusActions.text: The golem casts the Slow spell, requiring no spell components and using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).

traits.name: Dreamwalker's Charm
traits.text: An enemy that starts its turn within 30 feet of the giant must make a DC 13 Charisma saving throw, provided that the giant isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the giant. A creature charmed in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once it succeeds on the saving throw, the creature is immune to this giant's Dreamwalker's Charm for 24 hours.

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two Greatclub or Rock attacks.

attacks.name: Greatclub
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Rock
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

special.name: Petrifying Touch
special.text: The giant touches one Medium or smaller creature within 10 feet of it that is charmed by it. The target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes petrified, and the giant can adhere the target to its stony body. greater restoration spells and other magic that can undo petrification have no effect on a petrified creature adhered to the giant unless the giant is dead, in which case the magic works normally, freeing the petrified creature as well as ending the petrified condition on it.

name: Stone Dragon Statue
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The statue has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The statue's weapon attacks are magical.

special.name: Steam Breath
special.text: The statue exhales steam in a line that is 30 feet long and 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 (2d4 + 2) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Statue of Vergadain
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The statue has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The statue's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Magic Theft
traits.text: As a bonus action, the golem targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw, or all magic items in its possession are teleported to the bottom of the pit in .

multiAttack.text: The statue makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Slow
special.text: The statue targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the statue remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

multiAttack.text: The statue makes five attacks: one with its headbutt and four with its lightning bolt blades.

attacks.name: Headbutt
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Lightning Bolt Blades
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Psychic Mirror
traits.text: If the hulk takes psychic damage, each creature within 10 feet of the hulk takes that damage instead; the hulk takes none of the damage. In addition, the hulk's thoughts and location can't be discerned by magic.

multiAttack.text: The hulk makes two Slam attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, the target also takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage and must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the target's next turn.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Reaping Arms
special.text: The hulk makes a separate Slam attack against each creature within 10 feet of it. Each creature that is hit must also succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

multiAttack.text: The spy makes three attacks, using Rapier or Hand Crossbow in any combination.

attacks.name: Rapier
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

attacks.name: Hand Crossbow
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range 30/120 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) Poison damage.

special.name: Smoke Bomb (1/Day)
special.text: The spy throws a bomb to a point it can see within 30 feet of itself. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Failure: 28 (8d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Blinded condition until the end of the spy's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

bonusActions.name: Cunning Action
bonusActions.text: The spy takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Joyful Presence
traits.text: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to any eladrin's Joyful Presence for 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Longsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

attacks.name: Longbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: Tasha's hideous laughter 1/day each: major image, suggestion

bonusActions.name: Fey Step
bonusActions.text: The eladrin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the leviathan. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the leviathan, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the leviathan's turns.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: Seth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Invisible in Water
traits.text: Seth has the invisible condition while fully immersed in water.

multiAttack.text: Seth makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d6 + 7) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

special.name: Riptide Breath
special.text: Seth exhales a torrent of frigid water in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) cold damage and has the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: Seth magically transforms into a Small Humanoid or a Beast that is Tiny or Small, while retaining his game statistics (other than his size). This transformation ends if Seth is reduced to 0 hit points or uses another bonus action to end it.

bonusActions.name: Superspeed (2/Day)
bonusActions.text: Seth's speed is doubled for as long as he maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). While his speed is increased in this way, all attack rolls against him are made with disadvantage, and he becomes partially incorporeal, allowing him to move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Seth takes 5 (1d10) force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.text: The angel's weapon attacks are magical. When the angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components: At will: detect evil and good 1/day each: commune, raise dead

multiAttack.text: The angel makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Mace
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

special.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
special.text: The angel touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: The angel magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the angel's choice). In a new form, the angel retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The golem makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Slow
special.text: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Sapphire
special.text: The sapphire has 3 charges. As an action, the golem can expend 1 charge to cast dispel magic (as a 9th-level spell) from the sapphire using Constitution as its spellcasting ability. The sapphire ceases to glow if all its charges are expended, but it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn and glows again once it has 1 or more charges.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Saemon wears a quiver of Ehlonna (holding handaxe).

multiAttack.text: Saemon makes three Handaxe attacks.

attacks.name: Handaxe
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Saemon casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation 2/day each: counterspell, detect magic, mage armor, magic missile, misty step, suggestion 1/day each: fly, greater invisibility, ice storm

reactions.name: Arcane Shield
reactions.text: Saemon conjures a swirling yellow barrier and until the start of his next turn he adds +5 to his AC, including against the triggering attack, and he takes no damage from magic missile.

actions.name: Hurl
actions.text: Saemon makes a ranged Handaxe attack.

actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Saemon uses Spellcasting.

actions.name: Animate Objects (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Saemon casts animate objects, targeting up to 10 handaxes he has thrown at enemies. If there are not 10 handaxes available, then he provides the remaining handaxes from his quiver of Ehlonna. Handaxes are Tiny objects.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Saemon casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

name: Reduced-Threat Stone Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.text: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The golem makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Slow
special.text: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.text: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Mucous Cloud
traits.text: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

traits.name: Probing Telepathy
traits.text: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

multiAttack.text: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Enslave (3/Day)
special.text: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The charmed target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.

actions.name: Detect
actions.text: The aboleth makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

actions.name: Tail Swipe
actions.text: The aboleth makes one tail attack.

actions.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: One creature charmed by the aboleth takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the damage the creature takes.

multiAttack.text: The performer makes three Bejeweled Baton attacks.

attacks.name: Bejeweled Baton
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) Psychic damage.

special.name: Majestic Song
special.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within 120 feet. Failure: 22 (4d8 + 4) Psychic damage, and the target has the Charmed or Frightened condition (performer's choice) until the end of the performer's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The performer casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: Mage Hand, Minor Illusion, Prestidigitation 1/day each: Major Image, Project Image

reactions.name: Warding Charm

components.trigger: A creature hits the performer with an attack roll.
components.failureEffect: The attack roll misses the performer, and the target has the Charmed condition until the end of the performer's next turn.

reactions.text: Trigger: A creature hits the performer with an attack roll. Response—Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 17, the triggering creature. Failure: The attack roll misses the performer, and the target has the Charmed condition until the end of the performer's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The performer casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The orthon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

attacks.name: Infernal Dagger
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d4 + 6) force damage, and the target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the target is poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

attacks.name: Brass Crossbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) force damage. The target also suffers one of the following effects of the orthon's choice; the orthon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

bonusActions.name: Invisibility Field
bonusActions.text: The orthon becomes invisible. Any equipment it wears or carries is also invisible as long as the equipment is on its person. This invisibility ends immediately after it makes an attack roll or is hit by an attack roll.

reactions.name: Explosive Retribution
reactions.text: In response to dropping to 15 hit points or fewer, the orthon explodes. All other creatures within 30 feet of it must each make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) fire damage plus 9 (2d8) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The orthon, its infernal dagger, and its brass crossbow are destroyed.

traits.name: Corrosive Form
traits.text: A creature that touches the Ooze Master or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon that hits the Ooze Master corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition that hits the Ooze Master is destroyed after dealing damage.

traits.name: Instinctive Attack
traits.text: When the Ooze Master casts a spell with a casting time of 1 action, it can make one pseudopod attack as a bonus action.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The Ooze Master can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.text: The Ooze Master is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): acid splash, friends, mage hand, poison spray 1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, magic missile, ray of sickness 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, Melf's acid arrow, suggestion 3rd level (3 slots): fear, slow, stinking cloud 4th level (3 slots): confusion, Evard's black tentacles 5th level (1 slots): cloudkill

attacks.name: Pseudopod
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage.

reactions.name: Instinctive Charm
reactions.text: If a creature the Ooze Master can see makes an attack roll against it while within 30 feet of it, the Ooze Master can use a reaction to divert the attack if another creature is within the attack's range. The attacker must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker targets the creature that is closest to it, not including itself or the Ooze Master. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. On a successful save, the attacker is immune to this Instinctive Charm for 24 hours. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ooze Master is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.text: The nonaton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Combat Ready
traits.text: The nonaton has advantage on initiative rolls.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.text: If the nonaton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

multiAttack.text: The nonaton makes three Arm attacks and uses Pillar of Truth or Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Arm
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the nonaton can't use this arm against other targets. The nonaton has nine arms, each of which can grapple one target.

special.name: Pillar of Truth
special.text: The nonaton chooses a point on the ground that it can see within 60 feet of itself. A 60-foot-tall, 20-foot-radius cylinder of magical force rises from that point. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 (6d6) force damage, and the creature reverts to its original form (if it's in a different form) and can't assume a different form until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The nonaton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action) 1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nonaton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

multiAttack.text: The noble makes three Beguiling Strike attacks.

attacks.name: Beguiling Strike
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) Psychic damage, and the target has the Charmed condition until the start of the noble's next turn.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The noble casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: Mage Armor (included in AC), Mage Hand, Minor Illusion 1/day each: Befuddlement, Detect Thoughts, Fly, Scrying, Shatter (level 7 version)

reactions.name: Shield (2/Day)
reactions.text: The noble casts Shield in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. 2 times per day: Shield

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The noble casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

traits.name: Mount
traits.text: If the specter isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto its gloamwing mount, provided the specter and the gloamwing are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the specter appears astride the gloamwing along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. While mounted and not incapacitated, the specter can't be surprised, and both it and its mount gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

multiAttack.text: The specter makes two scythe attacks.

attacks.name: Scythe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

special.name: Mind Twist
special.text: The specter magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 22 (5d8) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Reap Memory (3/Day)
special.text: The specter touches one incapacitated creature and chooses 1 hour from among the past 24. Unless the creature succeeds on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw, the creature loses all memory of that hour. The creature regains the memory only if the specter dies within the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.text: While the high curator is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

multiAttack.text: The high curator makes three Force Strike attacks and uses Brain Burn (if available).

attacks.name: Force Strike
attacks.text: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) force damage.

special.name: Brain Burn
special.text: The high curator targets up to two creatures it can see within 30 feet of itself. Each target must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes 28 (8d6) psychic damage and can't take reactions until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The high curator casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18): At will: detect magic 2/day each: detect thoughts, identify (as an action), scrying (as an action)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The high curator casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: If the mirror shade is within 5 feet of a reflective surface—such as a mirror, glass pane, or still water—it has advantage on its initiative roll. If a creature hasn't observed the mirror shade move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the mirror shade isn't the creature's own reflection.

traits.name: Mirror Movement
traits.text: The mirror shade can move along the surface of reflective or translucent objects, such as mirrors, without provoking opportunity attacks. It can move through translucent objects as if they were difficult terrain.

multiAttack.text: The mirror shade makes two Phantasmal Strike attacks and uses Reflect Fear.

attacks.name: Phantasmal Strike
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) radiant damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

special.name: Reflect Fear
special.text: The mirror shade targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself and projects an illusion of that creature's greatest fear. The target must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 28 (8d6) psychic damage and has the frightened condition until the start of the mirror shade's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

bonusActions.name: Mirror Stealth
bonusActions.text: While within 5 feet of a reflective surface, such as a mirror, the mirror shade takes the Hide action.

traits.name: Boo, The Miniature Giant Space Hamster
traits.text: Boo is Minsc's animal companion. Boo is a miniature giant space hamster and has the statistics of a rat.

traits.name: Favored Enemy
traits.text: Minsc's favored enemy is evil. When he hits an evil creature with a melee attack he deals an additional 7 (2d6) slashing damage.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.text: At the start of his turn, Minsc may choose to gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

multiAttack.text: Minsc makes two Greatsword attacks.

attacks.name: Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage

bonusActions.name: Go for the Eyes, Boo
bonusActions.text: As a bonus action, Minsc talks to Boo and gains the inspiration to go into a berserker fury, for 1 minute. While in this berserking fury Minsc gains the following:

reactions.name: Run, Boo, Run
reactions.text: If Boo takes damage, Minsc can choose to take the damage instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The maw has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The maw makes two Bite or Fang Fling attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Fang Fling
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage.

special.name: Gorging Charge
special.text: The maw moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures. Each time the maw enters a creature's space for the first time during this move, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or take 25 (3d12 + 6) piercing damage and have the grappled condition (escape DC 16); if a creature is already grappled this way, it has the prone condition. Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition. The maw can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

reactions.name: Fanged Rebuke
reactions.text: In response to taking damage, the maw makes one Bite attack against a random creature within 10 feet of itself. If no creature is within reach, the maw can make two Fang Fling attacks.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The kraken can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiAttack.text: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks. One of them can be replaced with a bite attack, and any of them can be replaced with Fling.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

special.name: Fling
special.text: One Medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken's tentacles is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

special.name: Lightning Storm
special.text: The kraken creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 150 feet of it. A target must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The maelephant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The maelephant makes one Barbed Trunk attack and two Glaive attacks.

attacks.name: Barbed Trunk
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) poison damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition. While it is grappling a creature, the maelephant can't use its barbed trunk to attack other creatures.

attacks.name: Glaive
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

special.name: Mind Poison
special.text: The maelephant expels poisonous gas from its trunk in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 39 (6d12) poison damage and has the poisoned condition. While poisoned in this way, the creature loses all weapon and skill proficiencies, it can't cast spells, it can't understand language, and it has disadvantage on Intelligence saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only and is immune to this maelephant's Mind Poison for 24 hours.

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Empath
traits.text: The shadow uses telepathy to sense nearby creatures. The shadow can see a creature if that creature has thoughts and is within the range of the shadow's telepathy. The shadow can't see creatures immune to telepathy.

traits.name: Undying Connection
traits.text: The shadow was originally spawned from a specific devil and, if the shadow is slain, it returns to life in 10 (1d20) days within 1 mile of that devil. The shadow is killed permanently only if its progenitor devil is slain first.

multiAttack.text: The shadow makes two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) necrotic damage, plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

special.name: Cloak of Shadows
special.text: The shadow bends darkness around itself, and now has the invisible condition for 1 minute. The invisibility ends if the shadow is subjected to a Daylight spell or similar.

special.name: Empathic Link
special.text: The shadow attempts to form a link between itself and a creature it can see. The target must make a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw, taking 6 (1d12) psychic damage on a success. On a failed save, the creature and the shadow are linked. While linked, every time the shadow is damaged, the creature takes half of that damage as psychic damage. The creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, taking 6 (1d12) psychic damage on a failed save, or ending the effect on a successful one.

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: The shadow transforms into a Beast, Humanoid or Fiend that it has an Empathic Link with, or back into its true form. In a new form, the shadow retains its alignment, hit points, hit dice, telepathy, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features, lair actions, or legendary actions of that form.

name: Lesser Death Dragon
languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The dragon has two claws, each of which can grapple one target.

special.name: Cataclysmic Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales a wave of ghostly purple flames in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature dies if the breath reduces it to 0 hit points. Additionally, any Medium or smaller Humanoid killed by the breath's damage, as well as every corpse of such a creatures within the cone, becomes a zombie (see the Monster Manual) under the dragon's control. The zombie acts on the dragon's initiative but immediately after the dragon's turn. Absent any other command, the zombie tries to kill any non-Undead creature it encounters.

name: Jade Giant Spider
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The spider is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The spider has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The spider's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The spider makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Slow
special.text: The spider targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Huge Stone Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The golem makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Slow
special.text: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.text: The angel's weapon attacks are magical. When the angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Heron Protection
traits.text: Whenever an angel of the Host of Herons or a friendly creature within 10 feet of it makes a saving throw, the creature gains a bonus to the saving throw equal to the angel's Charisma modifier. The angel must be conscious to receive or grant this bonus.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components: At will: detect evil and good 1/day each: commune, raise dead

multiAttack.text: The angel makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Mace
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

special.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
special.text: The angel touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: The angel magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the angel's choice). In a new form, the angel retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Darkness Dweller
traits.text: Attacks made against a bezekira in bright or dim light have disadvantage.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the bezekira's darkvision.

multiAttack.text: The bezekira makes three Claw attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a Bite attack.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage. The bezekira deals an extra 28 (8d6) fire damage when it hits a target with an attack and has advantage on the attack roll.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, grasping the target with its mouth. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 17). The bezekira can't make a Bite attack while a creature is grappled in this way.

name: Headless Iron Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Headless
traits.text: The golem is blinded and deafened, giving it disadvantage on all its attack rolls, and it can't use its Poison Breath.

traits.name: Fire Absorption
traits.text: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The golem makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Sword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) slashing damage.

traits.name: Haunted Zone
traits.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, any creature that casts a spell while inside the revenant's space. Failure: The spell fails and is wasted.

traits.name: Undead Restoration
traits.text: If the revenant dies, it revives 24 hours later unless Dispel Evil and Good is cast on its remains. If it revives, it animates another Gargantuan object or structure elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

multiAttack.text: The revenant makes two Object Slam attacks and uses Invitation.

attacks.name: Object Slam
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +9 (with Advantage if the target is inside the revenant's space), reach 10 ft. or range 30/90 ft. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Invitation
special.text: Charisma Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 60-foot Cone. Failure: The target is teleported inside the revenant's space and swallowed. A swallowed creature has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the revenant. While the revenant has Hit Points, a swallowed creature can leave the revenant's space only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the Plane Shift spell.

traits.name: Celestial Restoration
traits.text: If the naga dies, it returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its Hit Points unless Dispel Evil and Good is cast on its remains.

multiAttack.text: The naga makes two Bite attacks. It can replace any attack with a use of Poisonous Spittle.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 10 ft. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) Piercing damage plus 22 (4d10) Poison damage.

special.name: Poisonous Spittle
special.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature the naga can see within 60 feet. Failure: 31 (7d8) Poison damage, and the target has the Blinded condition until the start of the naga's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The naga casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: Thaumaturgy 1/day each: Clairvoyance, Cure Wounds (level 6 version), Flame Strike (level 6 version), Geas, True Seeing

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The naga casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.text: If it dies, the tentacle returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. Hit: The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Psychic Defense
traits.text: While the githzerai is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

multiAttack.text: The githzerai makes three Unarmed Strike attacks.

attacks.name: Unarmed Strike
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

attacks.name: Temporal Strike
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 52 (8d12) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or move 1 round forward in time. A target moved forward in time vanishes for the duration. When the effect ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in an unoccupied space nearest to that space if it's occupied.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The githzerai casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible) 3 times per day: see invisibility 1/day each: plane shift, teleport

reactions.name: Slow Fall
reactions.text: When the githzerai falls, it reduces any falling damage it takes by 50.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The githzerai casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

multiAttack.text: The githyanki makes three Longsword or Telekinetic Bolt attacks, or it makes one of those attacks and uses Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Longsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

attacks.name: Telekinetic Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (8d6) force damage.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The githyanki casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: light, mage hand (the hand is invisible), message 3/day each: fireball, invisibility, nondetection (self only) 1/day each: dimension door, plane shift, telekinesis

bonusActions.name: Astral Step
bonusActions.text: The githyanki teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The githyanki casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Gishath fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: Gishath makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stomp or tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 39 (5d12 + 7) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or it is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and Gishath can't bite another target.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (5d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Swallow
special.text: Gishath makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Gishath, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of Gishath's turns. If Gishath takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of it. If Gishath dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Attack
actions.text: Gishath makes one stomp or tail attack.

actions.name: Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Each creature that is within 120 feet of Gishath and can hear it must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Gishath's Roar for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Firearms Knowledge
traits.text: The giff's mastery of its weapons enables it to ignore the loading property of any firearm.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.text: If the giff fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The giff makes two Morningstar attacks.

attacks.name: Morningstar
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Double-Barreled Musket
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d12 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Move
actions.text: The giff moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

actions.name: Rallying Cry
actions.text: The giff ends the frightened condition on itself and each creature of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it.

actions.name: Weapon of Choice (2 Actions)
actions.text: The giff makes two Morningstar attacks or one Double-Barreled Musket attack.

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: While the gargoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

multiAttack.text: The gargoyle makes five attacks: one with its bite and four with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

name: Gearkeeper Construct
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The gearkeeper is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Rapid Shifting
traits.text: Opportunity attacks made against the gearkeeper have disadvantage.

traits.name: Whirling Blades
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the gearkeeper takes 4 (1d8) slashing damage.

multiAttack.text: The gearkeeper makes two Arm Blade attacks, or one Arm Blade attack and one Spear Launcher attack.

attacks.name: Arm Blade
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Spear Launcher
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is knocked prone.

special.name: Shrapnel Blast
special.text: The gearkeeper jettisons a spray of jagged metal in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

multiAttack.text: The frostmourn makes one Freezing Touch attack and one Icy Axe attack. It can replace one of these attacks with a Polar Ray attack.

attacks.name: Freezing Touch
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 18 (4d8) cold damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage. If this damage would reduce the target to 0 hit points, the target drops to 1 hit point instead and has the petrified condition, turning into a frozen statue.

attacks.name: Icy Axe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

attacks.name: Polar Ray
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (5d10 + 4) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

reactions.name: Blizzard Escape
reactions.text: Immediately after a creature the frostmourn can see hits it with an attack roll, the frostmourn momentarily dissolves into a blizzard, reducing the damage to itself by half. The frostmourn can then magically teleport to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Shock Susceptibility
traits.text: If the froghemoth takes lightning damage, it suffers two effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

multiAttack.text: The froghemoth makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks, and it can use Tongue.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth's turns.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the froghemoth can't use this tentacle on another target. The froghemoth has four tentacles.

special.name: Tongue
special.text: The froghemoth targets one Medium or smaller creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the froghemoth.

name: Four-Armed Statue
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The statue has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The statue's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The statue makes four sword attacks.

attacks.name: Sword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage.

special.name: Slow
special.text: The statue targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Contortionist
traits.text: The fomorian can enter a space large enough for a Large creature without squeezing.

traits.name: Crawling Stance
traits.text: While the fomorian has the prone condition, crawling does not cost it extra movement. In addition, the prone condition does not grant advantage on attack rolls against the fomorian.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The fomorian can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

multiAttack.text: The fomorian makes two Slam attacks and uses Crawling Hex if it is available.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Crawling Hex
special.text: The fomorian targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 31 (7d8) psychic damage, have the prone condition, and become cursed for 1 hour. While cursed this way, the target can't stand up and end the prone condition on itself.

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.text: The angel's weapon attacks are magical. When the angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Moonsilver Spear
traits.text: An angel of the Flight of Moonsilver wields a spear made from a shard of the Helvault. Hit points lost to this weapon's damage can be regained only through a short or long rest, rather than by regeneration, magic, or any other means. Once per turn, when the angel hits a creature with an attack using this weapon, it can wound the target. At the start of each of the wounded creature's turns, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage for each time the angel has wounded it, and it can then make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success. Alternatively, the wounded creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check, ending the effect of such wounds on it on a success.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components: At will: detect evil and good 1/day each: commune, raise dead

multiAttack.text: The angel makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Mace
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

special.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
special.text: The angel touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: The angel magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the angel's choice). In a new form, the angel retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.text: The angel's weapon attacks are magical. When the angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components: At will: detect evil and good, protection from evil and good 1/day each: commune, raise dead, dispel evil and good

multiAttack.text: The angel makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Mace
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

special.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
special.text: The angel touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: The angel magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the angel's choice). In a new form, the angel retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

traits.name: Shrapnel Explosion
traits.text: When the giant drops to 0 hit points, its armor explodes, destroying the giant's body and scattering the armor as shrapnel. Creatures within 10 feet of the giant when its armor explodes must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two Searing Scepter attacks or two Bolt of Imix attacks.

attacks.name: Searing Scepter
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage, and the target is magically branded. While branded in this way, the target becomes visible if it's invisible, can't become invisible, and sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius. The brand disappears after 24 hours, or it can be removed from a creature or an object by any spell that ends a curse.

attacks.name: Bolt of Imix
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or have the frightened condition until the end of the target's next turn.

traits.name: Antimagic Gullet
traits.text: Magical effects, including those produced by spells and magic items but excluding those created by artifacts or deities, are suppressed inside the eye monger's gullet. Any spell slot or charge expended by a creature in the gullet to cast a spell or activate a property of a magic item is wasted. While an effect is suppressed, it doesn't function, but the time it spends suppressed counts against its duration. No spell or magical effect that originates outside the eye monger's gullet, except one created by an artifact or a deity, can affect a creature or an object inside the gullet.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: If the eye monger is motionless and has its eye and mouth closed at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the eye monger move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the eye monger is animate.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The eye monger doesn't require air.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the eye monger and deposited in the eye monger's gullet (see Antimagic Gullet). The eye monger can swallow one creature at a time. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside the eye monger, and takes 35 (10d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the cluster fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The cluster has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The cluster makes two Slam attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Spawn Progeny if available.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and if the target is a creature, the target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition. If this attack reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target immediately dies and is consumed by the cluster.

special.name: Spawn Progeny (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special.text: The cluster bulges and spews 1d4 mature eggs. Each egg lands in an unoccupied space of the cluster's choice within 30 feet of itself and immediately transforms into an encephalon gemmule. The gemmules obey the cluster's commands and take their turns immediately after it.

reactions.name: Aggressive Hunger
reactions.text: Immediately after being hit by an attack, the cluster moves up to its speed toward the attacker. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. If the cluster ends this movement within 5 feet of the attacker, it then makes one Slam attack against that attacker.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.text: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Aversion to Fire
traits.text: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The oblex doesn't require sleep.

multiAttack.text: The elder oblex makes two Pseudopod attacks, and it uses Eat Memories.

attacks.name: Pseudopod
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage.

special.name: Eat Memories
special.text: The oblex targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or take 44 (8d10) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or heal spell. Constructs, Oozes, Plants, and Undead succeed on the save automatically. While memory drained, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from any ability check or attack roll it makes. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on until the die becomes a d20, at which point the target becomes unconscious for 1 hour. The effect then ends. The oblex learns all the languages a memory-drained target knows and gains all its skill proficiencies.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The oblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18): At will: charm person (as 5th-level spell), detect thoughts 3/day each: dimension door, dominate person, hypnotic pattern, telekinesis

bonusActions.name: Sulfurous Impersonation
bonusActions.text: The oblex extrudes a piece of itself that assumes the appearance of one Medium or smaller creature whose memories it has stolen. This simulacrum appears, feels, and sounds exactly like the creature it impersonates, though it smells faintly of sulfur. The oblex can impersonate 2d6 + 1 different creatures, each one tethered to its body by a strand of slime that can extend up to 120 feet away. The simulacrum is an extension of the oblex, meaning that the oblex occupies its space and the simulacrum's space simultaneously. The tether is immune to damage, but it is severed if there is no opening at least 1 inch wide between the oblex and the simulacrum. The simulacrum disappears if the tether is severed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The oblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

name: Dullahan
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Headless Summoning (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.text: If the dullahan is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, it regains 97 hit points. In addition, it summons three death's heads, one of each type, in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of it. The death's heads are under the dullahan's control and act immediately after the dullahan in the initiative order. Additionally, the dullahan can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section. Award a party an additional 5,900 XP (11,800 XP total) for defeating the dullahan after it uses Headless Summoning.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.text: If the dullahan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The dullahan doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The dullahan makes two attacks.

attacks.name: Battleaxe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. If the dullahan scores a critical hit against a creature, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or the dullahan cuts off the target's head. The target dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature that doesn't have or need a head, or has legendary actions, instead takes an extra 27 (6d8) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Fiery Skull
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) fire damage.

actions.name: Attack
actions.text: The dullahan makes one attack.

actions.name: Frightful Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Each creature of the dullahan's choice within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the dullahan until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Head Hunt (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: The dullahan moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes one Battleaxe attack with advantage. If the attack hits, but is not a critical hit, the attack deals an extra 27 (6d8) necrotic damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The worg has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The worg makes three Bite attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 5 ft. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the worg's next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points.

special.name: Dreadful Howl
special.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature within 30 feet that isn't a worg. Failure: 36 (8d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the start of the worg's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

bonusActions.name: Warp Step
