headerEntries: The Slaughter Lord's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Gatekeeper's Aura
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the phylaskia must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this aura for the next 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws and its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.text: If damage reduces the phylaskia to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the phylaskia drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Vigilant
traits.text: The phylaskia can't be surprised.

multiAttack.text: The phylaskia makes two longsword attacks and uses its Strength Drain once.

attacks.name: Longsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Strength Drain
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) necrotic damage. Unless the target is immune to necrotic damage, its Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

immunities.note: damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: Pelyious can hold his breath for 15 minutes.

multiAttack.text: In Humanoid form, Pelyious makes two Scimitar attacks or two Hand Crossbow attacks. In hybrid form, he can substitute one Scimitar attack for a Bite attack.

attacks.name: Scimitar (Humanoid or Hybrid Form)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form)
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Bite (Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 16) and until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and Pelyious can't Bite another target.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: Pelyious polymorphs into a crocodile-humanoid hybrid, or back into his true form, which is Humanoid. His statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He reverts to his true form if he dies.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Pelyious casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks): At will: fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation 2/day each: detect magic, mage armor, shield, suggestion 1/day each: cone of cold, counterspell, fly, greater invisibility

bonusActions.name: Slippery Step (2/Day)
bonusActions.text: Pelyious teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see and may use Change Shape.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Pelyious casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks):

traits.name: Blood Aegis
traits.text: The AC of the blood mage includes its Constitution modifier while it isn't wearing armor or wielding a shield.

traits.name: Oriq Mask
traits.text: The blood mage wears an Oriq mask. While wearing the mask, the blood mage can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and it adds double its proficiency bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks (included above).

traits.name: Sanguine Sense
traits.text: While the blood mage isn't blinded, it can see any creature that isn't an Undead or a Construct within 60 feet of itself, even through total cover, heavily obscured areas, invisibility, or any other phenomena that would prevent sight.

multiAttack.text: The blood mage makes two Blood Lash attacks.

attacks.name: Blood Lash
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the blood mage's next turn.

special.name: Blood Boil
special.text: The blood mage chooses a point within 150 feet of itself, and a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point fills with a burst of searing, blood-red mist. Each creature of the blood mage's choice that it can see in that area must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 38 (7d10) necrotic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated. A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this necrotic damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The oculorb has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Watchful Eyes
traits.text: The oculorb has advantage on initiative rolls and can't be surprised.

multiAttack.text: The oculorb makes two Dreadful Contact attacks or four Eye Beam attacks.

attacks.name: Dreadful Contact
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage, or 25 (6d6 + 4) psychic damage if the target has the frightened condition.

attacks.name: Eye Beam
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage.

special.name: Antipathic Flood
special.text: The oculorb releases a wave of negative emotions, choosing one of the following options:

special.name: Weeping Eyes
special.text: The oculorb weeps, releasing a wave of crushing despair. Each creature within 30 feet of the oculorb must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature's speed is reduced to 0 feet until the end of the oculorb's next turn, and if the creature was concentrating, its concentration is broken.

special.name: Withering Glare
special.text: The oculorb's eyes unleash furious scarlet energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) necrotic damage and has the frightened condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

reactions.name: Obsessive Rebuke
reactions.text: When the oculorb is damaged by a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself, it forces the creature to make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. The creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Fiendish Restoration
traits.text: If the nycaloth dies outside Gehenna, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in Gehenna.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The nycaloth has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The nycaloth makes two Mercurial Axe attacks.

attacks.name: Mercurial Axe
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +9, reach 10 ft. or range 30/90 ft. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Force damage. Hit or Miss: The axe magically returns to the nycaloth's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

bonusActions.name: Shadowy Teleport
bonusActions.text: The nycaloth has the Invisible condition for 1 minute, and it teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. The condition ends early immediately after it deals damage.

multiAttack.text: The necromancer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

attacks.name: Arcane Burst
attacks.text: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation 2/day each: bestow curse, dimension door, mage armor, web 1/day each: circle of death

bonusActions.name: Summon Undead (1/Day)
bonusActions.text: The necromancer magically summons five skeletons or zombies. The summoned creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the necromancer, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the necromancer. Each lasts for 1 hour, until it or the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer dismisses it as a bonus action.

reactions.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
reactions.text: When the necromancer kills a creature with necrotic damage, the necromancer regains 9 (2d8) hit points.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Potion Mishap
traits.description: When Nauk uses the Imbibe Potion action more than once in an hour, roll 1d4 for what happens:
traits.text: When Nauk uses the Imbibe Potion action more than once in an hour, roll 1d4 for what happens:

traits.name: Relentless
traits.text: When Nauk is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, he can drop to 1 hit point instead. He can't use this feature again for 24 hours

traits.name: Special Items
traits.text: Nauk wears adamantine plate armor. He wields a +1 maul and a +1 heavy crossbow which is already factored into his stats. He has 2 potion of cold resistance, 2 potion of fire resistance, 2 potion of lightning resistance. He has 2 potion of heroism and 4 potion of superior healing.

multiAttack.text: Nauk makes three Magic Maul attacks. Nauk may substitute one of those attacks for the Imbibe Potion action.

attacks.name: Magic Maul
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Heavy Crossbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, ranged 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

special.name: Imbibe Potion
special.description: Nauk drinks a potion from the following list:
special.text: Nauk drinks a potion from the following list:

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.text: Nauk adds 4 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Nauk must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Blood Aegis
traits.text: The AC of Murgaxor includes his Constitution modifier while he isn't wearing armor or wielding a shield.

traits.name: Oriq Mask
traits.text: Murgaxor wears an Oriq mask. While wearing the mask, Murgaxor can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and he adds double his proficiency bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks (included above).

traits.name: Sanguine Sense
traits.text: While Murgaxor isn't blinded, he can see any creature that isn't an Undead or a Construct within 60 feet of himself, even through total cover, heavily obscured areas, invisibility, or any other phenomena that would prevent sight.

multiAttack.text: Murgaxor makes two Blood Lash attacks.

attacks.name: Blood Lash
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of Murgaxor's next turn.

special.name: Blood Boil
special.text: Murgaxor chooses a point within 150 feet of himself, and a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point fills with a burst of searing, blood-red mist. Each creature of Murgaxor's choice that he can see in that area must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 38 (7d10) necrotic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated. A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this necrotic damage.

traits.name: Aura of Blood Lust
traits.text: When any other creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the master, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, or it must immediately take the Attack action, making one melee attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, it makes a ranged attack against a random creature within range, throwing its weapon if necessary.

traits.name: Feed on the Crowd
traits.text: Whenever a creature within 60 feet of the master dies, the master gains 15 temporary hit points and has advantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The master has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The master's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The master can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: charm person (as a 3rd-level spell), crown of madness once per day: dominate person

multiAttack.text: The master makes two melee attacks with its spear.

attacks.name: Spear
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

special.name: Captivating Presence
special.text: Each creature within 120 feet of the master must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the master for 1 hour. While charmed in this way, a creature's speed is 0. If the charmed creature takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Captivating Presence of all masters of cruelties for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The master's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The master can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

immunities.note: damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.text: Lothar can mimic simple sounds he has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Insight) check.

multiAttack.text: Lothar makes three Greataxe attacks.

attacks.name: Greataxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage, 14 (1d12 + 8) while in a rage.

attacks.name: Beak (Raven or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage in raven form, or 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage in hybrid form. If the target is Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereraven lycanthropy.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: Lothar can use his action to polymorph into a raven-humanoid hybrid, or into a Small raven, or back into his true form, which is Humanoid. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. Lothar reverts to his true form if he dies.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Lothar casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks): At will: blade ward, eldritch blast, message 1/day each: bane, charm person, daylight, faerie fire, fear, misty step, plane shift

bonusActions.name: Rage
bonusActions.text: Lothar rages for 1 minute. During his rage he has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. He gains a +4 bonus to damage while he is in a rage. He has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while in a rage. Lothar can't cast spells while in a rage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lothar casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks):

resistances.condition: while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Psychic Leech
traits.text: At the start of each of the sorrowsworn's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Thrives on Company
traits.text: The sorrowsworn has advantage on attack rolls while it is within 30 feet of at least two other creatures. It otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

multiAttack.text: The sorrowsworn makes one Harpoon Arm attack, and it uses Sorrowful Embrace.

attacks.name: Harpoon Arm
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature. The sorrowsworn has two harpoon arms and can grapple up to two creatures at once.

special.name: Sorrowful Embrace
special.text: Each creature grappled by the sorrowsworn must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In either case, the sorrowsworn pulls each of those creatures up to 30 feet straight toward it.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.text: The lightning hulk sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

traits.name: Lightning Form
traits.text: The lightning hulk can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time the lightning hulk enters a creature's space on a turn, or if it begins its turn in a creature's space, that creature takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage. The hulk can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing. A creature that touches the lightning hulk or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage.

attacks.name: Arc Lightning
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and lightning jumps from the target to another creature of the lightning hulk's choice that it can see within 30 feet of the target. The second creature must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 18 (4d8) lightning damage.

name: Jiangshi
languages: any languages it knew in life

traits.name: Jiangshi Weaknesses
traits.text: The jiangshi has the following flaws:

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The jiangshi doesn't require air.

multiAttack.text: The jiangshi makes three Slam attacks and uses Consume Energy.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Consume Energy
special.text: The jiangshi draws energy from a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target makes a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The jiangshi regains hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. After regaining hit points from this action, the jiangshi gains the following benefits for 7 days: its walking speed increases to 40 feet, and it gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed and can hover. A Humanoid slain by this necrotic damage rises as a wight (see its entry in the Monster Manual) at the end of the jiangshi's turn. The wight acts immediately after the jiangshi in the initiative order. If this wight slays a Humanoid with its Life Drain, the wight transforms into a jiangshi 5 days later.

special.name: Change Shape
special.text: The jiangshi polymorphs into a Beast, a Humanoid, or an Undead that is Medium or Small or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the jiangshi's choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The hydroloth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The hydroloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Secure Memory
traits.text: The hydroloth is immune to the waters of the River Styx, as well as any effect that would steal or modify its memories or detect or read its thoughts.

traits.name: Watery Advantage
traits.text: While submerged in liquid, the hydroloth has advantage on attack rolls.

multiAttack.text: The hydroloth makes two Bite or Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) force damage plus 9 (2d10) psychic damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) force damage plus 9 (2d10) psychic damage.

special.name: Steal Memory (1/Day)
special.text: The hydroloth targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage, and it must make a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to this hydroloth's Steal Memory for 24 hours. On a failed save, the target loses all proficiencies; it can't cast spells; it can't understand language; and if its Intelligence and Charisma scores are higher than 5, they become 5. Each time the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration or remove curse spell cast on the target ends this effect early.

special.name: Teleport
special.text: The hydroloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The hydroloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility (self only) 3/day each: control water, crown of madness, fear, suggestion

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hydroloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

name: Hulking Shadow
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Acid Absorption
traits.text: Whenever the shadow is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

traits.name: Berserk
traits.text: Whenever the shadow starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the shadow goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the shadow attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the shadow attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the shadow goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The shadow is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The shadow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The shadow's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The shadow makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

special.name: Haste
special.text: Until the end of its next turn, the shadow magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
traits.text: The quori's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At will: charm person once per day: dominate person, dream 3/day each: detect thoughts, disguise self, suggestion

multiAttack.text: The quori uses its Mind Thrust twice.

attacks.name: Idyllic Touch
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or fall prone in a fit of laughter.

special.name: Mind Thrust
special.text: The quori targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Possession
special.text: One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

reactions.name: Empathic Feedback
reactions.text: When the quori takes damage from a creature it can see within 60 feet of it, the quori can force that creature to succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The quori's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.text: Gremorly can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when he is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: Gremorly can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. He takes 5 (1d10) force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Gremorly fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: Gremorly makes three Withering Strike attacks.

attacks.name: Withering Strike
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d12) necrotic damage.

special.name: Fell Necromancy
special.text: Gremorly targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of himself. The target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 61 (7d8 + 30) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, Gremorly regains 9 (2d8) hit points.

special.name: Possession
special.text: One Humanoid Gremorly can see within 5 feet of himself must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by him; Gremorly disappears, and the target has the incapacitated condition and loses control of its body. Gremorly can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn Undead, and he retains his alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to the charmed and frightened conditions. He otherwise uses the target's game statistics, but Gremorly doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The possession lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, Gremorly ends it as a bonus action, or Gremorly is turned or forced out by an effect like the Dispel Evil and Good spell. When the possession ends, Gremorly reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target. The target is immune to this Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Gremorly casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: Dancing Lights, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation once per day: Slow 2/day each: Bestow Curse, Dispel Magic

bonusActions.name: Ethereal Step
bonusActions.text: Gremorly teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Gremorly casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The slaad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The slaad regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

multiAttack.text: The slaad makes two Chaos Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Chaos Claw
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 10 ft. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) Necrotic damage. Until the start of the slaad's next turn, the target has a condition determined by rolling 1d4: on a 1, Charmed; on a 2, Frightened; on a 3, Poisoned; or on a 4, Incapacitated.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The slaad casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Invisibility (self only), Mage Hand, Major Image 1/day each: Cloudkill, Fly, Plane Shift (self only), Tongues

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The slaad shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The slaad casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

traits.name: Demonic Restoration
traits.text: If the glabrezu dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The glabrezu has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The glabrezu makes two Pincer attacks and uses Pummel or Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Pincer
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 10 ft. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 15) from one of two pincers.

special.name: Pummel
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, one creature Grappled by the glabrezu. Failure: 15 (3d6 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. Success: Half damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The glabrezu casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: Darkness, Detect Magic, Dispel Magic 1/day each: Confusion, Fly, Power Word Stun

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The glabrezu casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

traits.name: Psychic Defense
traits.text: While the githzerai is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

multiAttack.text: The githzerai makes three Unarmed Strike or Psychic Bolt attacks.

attacks.name: Unarmed Strike
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

attacks.name: Psychic Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) psychic damage.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The githzerai casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: dispel magic, levitate (self only), mage hand (the hand is invisible), see invisibility 1/day each: plane shift (self only), scrying (as an action), slow, telekinesis

reactions.name: Future Insight (3/Day)
reactions.text: When the githzerai or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the githzerai can cause the roll to be made with advantage or disadvantage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The githzerai casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

multiAttack.text: The githyanki makes three Staff attacks, three Telekinetic Bolt attacks, or a combination thereof.

attacks.name: Staff
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands, plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage.

attacks.name: Telekinetic Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) force damage.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The githyanki casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: druidcraft, light, mage hand (the hand is invisible) 2/day each: invisibility (self only), pass without trace (self only) 1/day each: dominate monster, forcecage, plane shift, telekinesis

bonusActions.name: Astral Step
bonusActions.text: The githyanki teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The githyanki casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The drow has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). The drow can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: dancing lights 1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

multiAttack.text: The drow makes two morningstar attacks.

attacks.name: Morningstar
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Rock
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). The drow can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Burning Fury
traits.text: When the salamander takes fire damage, its

multiAttack.text: The salamander makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) cold damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage.

special.name: Freezing Breath
special.text: The salamander exhales chill wind in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Numbing Aura
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature can't make more than one attack, or take a bonus action on that turn.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is fire, radiant, or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

multiAttack.text: The zombie makes two weapon attacks.

attacks.name: Greataxe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Hurl Rock
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Freezing Stare
special.text: The zombie targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 35 (10d6) cold damage and be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

multiAttack.text: The law bender makes three Arcane Burst attacks and uses Power of Authority or Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Arcane Burst
attacks.text: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) force damage.

special.name: Power of Authority
special.text: The law bender targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage and have the incapacitated condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the incapacitated condition on itself on a success. A target that succeeds on the saving throw becomes immune to this law bender's Power of Authority for 24 hours.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The law bender casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability: At will: dispel magic, fly, mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation

bonusActions.name: Spatial Loophole
bonusActions.text: The law bender teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reactions.name: Probability Loophole (3/Day)
reactions.text: When the law bender or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the law bender can cause the roll to be made with advantage or disadvantage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The law bender casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The fractine has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Scrying Focus
traits.text: A spellcaster can use the fractine as a substitute focus when casting the scrying spell or similar magic, provided the spellcaster and the fractine are within 5 feet of each other.

traits.name: Two-Dimensionality
traits.text: The fractine can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. It can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, but it takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The fractine doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

attacks.name: Extradimensional Touch
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (8d6) force damage.

bonusActions.name: Imprison
bonusActions.text: The fractine targets one creature of its size or smaller in its space. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or be imprisoned in a demiplane. While the creature is imprisoned, a distorted image of it can be seen on the fractine's two-dimensional surface.

reactions.name: Mirrored Damage
reactions.text: In response to being damaged by a creature it can see within 120 feet of itself, the fractine forces that creature to make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 24 (8d6) force damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

reactions.name: Split
reactions.text: When a Large fractine that has at least 10 hit points remaining takes bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, or thunder damage from any source, it splits into two Medium fractines. The new fractines occupy the space formerly occupied by the original fractine, and each new fractine has hit points equal to half the original's, rounded down. If the original fractine had a creature trapped in its demiplane, that creature is released when the fractine splits, reappearing in an unoccupied space as close to the new fractines as possible.

traits.name: Aura of Blood Thirst
traits.text: If the flind isn't incapacitated, any creature with the Rampage trait can make a Bite attack as a bonus action while within 10 feet of the flind.

multiAttack.text: The flind makes one Flail of Chaos attack, one Flail of Pain attack, and one Flail of Paralysis attack, or it makes three Longbow attacks.

attacks.name: Flail of Chaos
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must use its reaction, if available, to make one melee attack against a random creature, other than the flind, within its reach. If there's no creature within reach, the target instead moves half its speed in a random direction.

attacks.name: Flail of Pain
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage.

attacks.name: Flail of Paralysis
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

attacks.name: Longbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Battle Smith
traits.text: Flimp uses his Intelligence modifier for attack and damage rolls with his weapons.

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
traits.text: Flimp has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Saving Throws against magic.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Flimp wears a cloak of the manta ray, a cloak of protection, +2 plate armor, and winged boots. Flimp wields a +2 warhammer. These items vanish 4 days after Flimp dies.

multiAttack.text: Flimp makes two Magic Warhammer attacks.

attacks.name: Magic Warhammer
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

special.name: Hurl Acid
special.text: Flimp hurls a vial of acid at a location within 60 feet. Every creature within 10 feet of the target location must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take 21 (6d6) acid damage.

special.name: Summon Steel Defender (1/Day)
special.text: Flimp summons a metallic panther to aid him in combat. The panther has 24 hit points and is immune to poison damage and the poison and charmed conditions.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Flimp casts one of the following spells using Intelligence as his spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): At will: guidance, light 2/day each: aid, blur, cure wounds, shield 1/day each: blink, elemental weapon, fire shield

reactions.name: Flash of Genius
reactions.text: When Flimp or another creature he can see within 30 feet of him makes an ability check or a saving throw, Flimp can use his reaction to add +4 to the roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Flimp casts one of the following spells using Intelligence as his spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two greataxe attacks.

attacks.name: Greataxe +2
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Rock
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two attacks, using Flame Sword or Hammer Throw in any combination.

attacks.name: Flame Sword
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 10 ft. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

attacks.name: Hammer Throw
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +11, range 60/240 ft. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) Bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) Fire damage, and the target is pushed up to 15 feet straight away from the giant and has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Bladed Edges
traits.text: A creature takes 10 (3d6) slashing damage if it starts its turn grappling or being grappled by the ferrumach.

traits.name: Skewering Charge
traits.text: If the ferrumach moves at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a Large or smaller creature and ends within 5 feet of it, that creature must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or have the grappled condition (escape DC 18) and take 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

multiAttack.text: The ferrumach makes three Sharpened Limb or Bolt attacks.

attacks.name: Sharpened Limb
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

attacks.name: Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The ferrumach casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): At will: detect magic 1/day each: dispel magic, ice storm

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ferrumach casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

name: Eye of Fear and Flame
languages: all languages known by any creature within 30 feet of it

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.text: The eye of fear and flame is immune to effects that turn undead.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The eye of fear and flame's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At will: detect evil and good, detect thoughts 1/day each: etherealness, true seeing

multiAttack.text: The eye of fear and flame makes two claw attacks and uses its Gemstone Eyes.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) slashing damage.

special.name: Gemstone Eyes
special.description: The eye of fear and flame shoots one of the following magical eye rays, choosing one target it can see within 90 feet of it.
special.text: The eye of fear and flame shoots one of the following magical eye rays, choosing one target it can see within 90 feet of it.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eye of fear and flame's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

multiAttack.text: The evoker makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

attacks.name: Arcane Burst
attacks.text: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) force damage.

special.name: Sculpted Explosion
special.text: The evoker unleashes a magical explosion of a particular damage type: cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. The magic erupts in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 150 feet of the evoker. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. The evoker can select up to three creatures it can see in the area to ignore the spell, as the evoker sculpts the spell's energy around them. On a failed save, a creature takes 40 (9d8) damage of the chosen type and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The evoker casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation 2/day each: ice storm, lightning bolt, mage armor 1/day each: wall of ice

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The evoker casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

name: Drowned Master
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Bound Together
traits.text: The drowned master shares its mind with every other drowned one within 1 mile of it, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously and without limitation.

traits.name: Cold Aura
traits.text: At the start of each of the drowned master's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) cold damage. A creature that touches the drowned master or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) cold damage.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.text: If damage reduces the drowned master to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned master drops to 1 hit point instead.

multiAttack.text: The drowned master makes two attacks: one with its greatsword and one with its Life-Draining Tentacle.

attacks.name: Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or contract (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

attacks.name: Life-Draining Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. On a failed save, the target also contracts bluerot (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

special.name: Necrotic Ink
special.text: The drowned master discharges foul ink in front of itself in a 30-foot cone. Each creature caught in the ink must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw is blinded until the end of its next turn and contracts bluerot (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

multiAttack.text: The drow makes two Scimitar attacks and one Whip or Hand Crossbow attack.

attacks.name: Scimitar
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Whip
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Hand Crossbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): At will: dancing lights 1/day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

bonusActions.name: Battle Command
bonusActions.text: Choose one creature within 30 feet of the drow that the drow can see. If the chosen creature can see or hear the drow, that creature can use its reaction to make one melee attack or to take the Dodge or Hide action.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.text: The drow adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack roll that would hit it. To do so, the drow must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.text: If the displacer fiend is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Displacement
traits.text: The displacer fiend projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer fiend is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

multiAttack.text: The displacer fiend makes three Tentacle attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a Bite attack.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d12 + 4) piercing damage, and the target's Dexterity score is reduced by 2 (1d4). The target is killed if this reduces its Dexterity to 0. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

bonusActions.name: Shadowhop
bonusActions.text: While in dim light or darkness, the displacer fiend can teleport up to 60 feet, provided its destination is also in dim light or darkness.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The deep crow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.text: While in dim light or darkness, the deep crow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the deep crow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

multiAttack.text: The deep crow makes three attacks: one with its mandibles and two with its claws.

attacks.name: Mandibles
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the deep crow can't use its mandibles on another target.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Darien can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet

traits.name: Eldritch Mind
traits.text: Darien has advantage on Constitution saving throws that she makes to maintain concentration on a spell.

multiAttack.text: Darien makes two War Pick attacks.

attacks.name: War Pick
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 4 necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Eldritch Blast
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 300 ft., three targets. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) force damage.

special.name: Create Thrall
special.text: Darien touches an incapacitated Humanoid. That creature is then charmed by her until a remove curse spell is cast on it, the charmed condition is removed from it, or she uses this feature again. Darien can communicate telepathically with the charmed creature as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence.

special.name: Summon War Pick
special.text: Darien creates a magical war pick in her empty hand. The war pick counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. The war pick has a +1 bonus to attack and damage (already factored into Darien's attacks).

special.name: Innate Spellcasting
special.text: Darien casts one of the following spells, requiring no material component and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks): At will: alter self, blade ward, chill touch, disguise self, false life, invisibility, mage armor (self only), silent image 2/day each: armor of Agathys, cone of cold, darkness, fear, hallucinatory terrain, hold person, hypnotic pattern, major image, mirror image, mislead, sleet storm 1/day each: dream, feeblemind, mass suggestion, project image

reactions.name: Shield of Cryonax (1/Day)
reactions.text: When Darien takes damage, she can entomb herself in ice, which melts away at the end of her next turn. She gains 150 temporary hit points, which take as much of the triggering damage as possible. Immediately after she takes the damage, she gains vulnerability to fire damage, her speed is reduced to 0, and she is incapacitated. These effects, including any remaining temporary hit points, all end when the ice melts.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Darien casts one of the following spells, requiring no material component and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks):

traits.name: Psychic Maelstrom
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the shark must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The shark regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the shark takes radiant damage or suffers a critical hit, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The shark dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.text: The shark can breathe only underwater.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature missing any hit points), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Coral has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: Coral makes two Hoof attacks and uses Tail Thump.

attacks.name: Hoof
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Tail Thump
special.text: Coral slams her tail down, unleashing a burst of magical force toward one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) force damage and has the prone condition. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target dies, and its body is reduced to fine dust.

bonusActions.name: Bubbles of Whimsy (2/Day)
bonusActions.text: Coral produces a stream of magical bubbles from her horn. These bubbles float toward a creature Coral can see within 60 feet of herself. Roll a d6 to determine the bubbles' effect:

bonusActions.name: Gift of Speech (1/Day)
bonusActions.text: Coral targets one Beast she can see within 10 feet of herself. The target gains the ability to understand and speak Common or Sylvan (Coral's choice) for 10 minutes.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.text: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they and the dryad shared a language.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: druidcraft 3/day each: dispel magic, entangle, plant growth, spike growth 1/day each: moonbeam, grasping vine, wall of thorns

multiAttack.text: The dryad makes three attacks, using its vine staff, its longbow, or both.

attacks.name: Vine Staff
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained by twisting vines for 1 minute. A target restrained in this way can use an action to make a DC 17 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, ending the effect on itself on a success.

attacks.name: Longbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

special.name: Summon Mount (1/Day)
special.text: The dryad magically summons a mount, which appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the dryad. The mount remains for 8 hours, until it or the dryad dies, or until the dryad dismisses it as an action. The mount uses the stat block of an elk (see the Monster Manual) with these changes: it is a plant instead of a beast, it has an Intelligence of 6, and it understands Sylvan but can't speak. While within 1 mile of the mount, the dryad can communicate with it telepathically.

special.name: Suppress Magic
special.text: The dryad targets one magic item it can see within 120 feet of it. If the magic item isn't an artifact, its magical properties are suppressed for 10 minutes, until the dryad is incapacitated or dies, or until the dryad uses a bonus action to end the effect.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light 3/day each: feather fall, fly, misty step, telekinesis 1/day each: control weather, gaseous form

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two morningstar attacks.

attacks.name: Morningstar
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Rock
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.text: The ghost can see 120 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.text: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The ghost regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the ghost takes radiant damage or damage from a magic weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the ghost's next turn. The ghost dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

multiAttack.text: The ghost makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Spectral Weapon
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) force damage.

special.name: Etherealness
special.text: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

special.name: Wind Howl
special.text: The ghost emits a dreadful howl that summons a cold, biting wind. This wind engulfs up to three creatures of the ghost's choice that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target is pulled up to 20 feet toward the ghost and must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The ghost casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability and requiring no material components: At will: fog cloud once per day: control weather 3 times per day: telekinesis

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ghost casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability and requiring no material components:

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two attacks, using Thunderous Mace or Thundercloud in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Fog Cloud.

attacks.name: Thunderous Mace
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach 10 ft. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Thunder damage.

attacks.name: Thundercloud
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +12, range 240 ft. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) Thunder damage, and the target has the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: Detect Magic, Fog Cloud, Light 1/day each: Control Weather, Gaseous Form, Telekinesis

bonusActions.name: Misty Step
bonusActions.text: The giant casts the Misty Step spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. At will: Misty Step

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Acid Absorption
traits.text: Whenever the golem is subjected to Acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Acid damage dealt.

traits.name: Berserk
traits.text: Whenever the golem starts its turn Bloodied, roll 1d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to be berserk until it is destroyed or it is no longer Bloodied.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem can't shape-shift.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The golem makes two Slam attacks, or it makes three Slam attacks if it used Hasten this turn.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) Bludgeoning damage plus 6 (1d12) Acid damage, and the target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Acid damage taken.

bonusActions.name: Hasten
bonusActions.text: The golem takes the Dash and Disengage actions.

traits.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
traits.text: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

multiAttack.text: The champion makes three Greatsword or Shortbow attacks.

attacks.name: Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage, plus 7 (2d6) slashing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

attacks.name: Shortbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

bonusActions.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonusActions.text: The champion regains 20 hit points.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The ceratops has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The ceratops makes one Gore attack and one Stomp attack.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) piercing damage. If the ceratops moved at least 20 feet in a straight line toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 11 (2d10) piercing damage; if the target is a creature, it also must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet from the ceratops and have the prone condition.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

multiAttack.text: The cairnwight makes two Slam attacks or two Rock attacks, and it uses its Petrifying Touch if available.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Rock
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

special.name: Petrifying Touch
special.text: The cairnwight touches one creature it can see within 10 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 26 (4d12) force damage and have the restrained condition as it begins to turn to stone. The affected target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends on the target. On a failed save, the target has the petrified condition instead of the restrained condition.

traits.name: Flame Aura
traits.text: At the end of each of the gorgon's turns, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the gorgon takes 13 (3d8) Fire damage.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.text: The gorgon sheds Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet.

multiAttack.text: The gorgon makes two Gore attacks.

attacks.name: Gore
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

special.name: Smelting Charge
special.text: The gorgon moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and can move through the spaces of Medium or smaller creatures. Each time the gorgon enters a creature's space for the first time during this move, that target is subjected to the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) Fire damage, and the target is pulled into the gorgon's space and has the Grappled condition (escape DC 14); if the gorgon already has a creature Grappled, the target has the Prone condition instead. Until the grapple ends, the target has the Restrained condition. When the gorgon moves, the Grappled target moves with it, costing no extra movement.

traits.name: Intellect Fortress
traits.text: The braxat's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

multiAttack.text: The braxat makes two Greatclub attacks.

attacks.name: Greatclub
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Acid Breath
special.text: The braxat exhales a 15-foot cone of acid. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 26 (4d12) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The braxat casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): 1/day each: compulsion, fear

reactions.name: Psionic Shield (3/Day)
reactions.text: When the braxat would be hit by an attack roll or a magic missile spell that originates from a source the braxat can see, the braxat can create an invisible barrier of magical force around itself that lasts until the start of its next turn. This barrier gives the braxat a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and prevents magic missile spells from damaging it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The braxat casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

name: Boss Delour
languages: Thieves' cant (can't speak in rat form)

traits.name: Evasion
traits.text: If Delour is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if he fails, provided he doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

traits.name: Nimbleness
traits.text: Delour can move through the space of a Medium or larger creature.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: Delour regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Delour dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

multiAttack.text: Delour makes any combination of three Bite, Shortsword, or Hand Crossbow attacks.

attacks.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (5d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with lycanthropy. While cursed in this way, the target retains its alignment, languages, and equipment but otherwise uses the wererat stat block, excluding actions that require equipment the target doesn't have. During any night when there's a full moon in the sky, the target becomes an NPC under the DM's control and remains so until the night ends. A Remove Curse spell or similar magic ends this curse.

attacks.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

attacks.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: Delour polymorphs into a rat-humanoid hybrid, a Medium giant rat, or his humanoid form. His statistics, other than his size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He reverts to his humanoid form if he dies.

bonusActions.name: Cunning Action
bonusActions.text: Delour takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

name: Boss Augustus
languages: Thieves' cant (can't speak in wolf form)

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: Augustus regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Augustus dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Augustus wields a +2 Longsword.

multiAttack.text: Augustus makes any combination of two Bite, Claw, or Magic Longsword attacks.

attacks.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (5d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with lycanthropy. While cursed in this way, the target retains its alignment, languages, and equipment but otherwise uses the werewolf stat block, excluding actions that require equipment the target doesn't have. During any night when there's a full moon in the sky, the target becomes an NPC under the DM's control and remains so until the night ends. A Remove Curse spell or similar magic ends this curse.

attacks.name: Claw (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

attacks.name: Magic Longsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) slashing damage.

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: Augustus polymorphs into a wolf-humanoid hybrid, a wolf, or his humanoid form. His statistics, other than his speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He reverts to his humanoid form if he dies.

bonusActions.name: Cunning Action
bonusActions.text: Augustus takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Diabolical Restoration
traits.text: If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The devil makes two Claw attacks and one Infernal Sting attack.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 10 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage.

attacks.name: Infernal Sting
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 10 ft. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the devil's next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.text: The lieutenant has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lieutenant's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

multiAttack.text: The lieutenant makes three Longsword or Javelin Launcher attacks.

attacks.name: Longsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 20 (3d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

attacks.name: Javelin Launcher
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target has the prone condition.

bonusActions.name: Command Ally
bonusActions.text: The lieutenant targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of itself. If the target can see or hear the lieutenant, the target can make one melee attack using its reaction, if available, and has advantage on the attack roll.

bonusActions.name: Rally the Troops (1/Day)
bonusActions.text: The lieutenant ends the charmed and frightened conditions on itself and each creature of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of itself.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.text: The lieutenant adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the lieutenant must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
