attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

attacks.name: Light Crossbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Poison Breath
special.text: The half-dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Vigilant
traits.text: The giant can't be surprised.

multiAttack.text: The giant makes three spear attacks.

attacks.name: Spear
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) piercing damage, or 20 (3d8 + 7) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

reactions.name: Protection
reactions.text: When an attacker the giant can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 10 feet of the giant, the giant can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The slaad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The slaad regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

multiAttack.text: The slaad makes three Chaos Staff attacks.

attacks.name: Chaos Staff
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Force damage. Until the start of the slaad's next turn, the target has a condition determined by rolling 1d4: on a 1, Charmed; on a 2, Frightened; on a 3, Poisoned; or on a 4, Incapacitated.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The slaad casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks): At will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Mage Hand 1/day each: Fireball, Invisibility (self only)

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The slaad shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The slaad casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):

speedConditions.walk: (40 ft. swim 30 ft. in bear or hybrid form)

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The werebear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Mountain Born
traits.text: The werebear is acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

traits.name: Powerful Build (Humanoid Form Only)
traits.text: The werebear counts as one size larger when determining its carrying capacity and the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: The werebear can use its action to polymorph into a Large bear-humanoid hybrid or into a Large polar bear, or back into its goliath form. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

multiAttack.text: The werebear makes two melee attacks.

attacks.name: Bite (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebear lycanthropy, as described in the Monster Manual.

attacks.name: Claw (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Greataxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) slashing damage.

reactions.name: Stone's Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reactions.text: When the werebear takes damage, it reduces the damage taken by 10 (1d12 + 4).

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The vampire has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Rampage
traits.text: When it reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the vampire can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.text: If the vampire isn't in sunlight, it can use its action to polymorph into a Large hyena or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The vampire doesn't require air.

traits.name: Vampire Weaknesses
traits.description: The vampire has the following flaws:
traits.text: The vampire has the following flaws:

multiAttack.text: The vampire makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite (Hyena or Vampire Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

attacks.name: Claws (Vampire Form Only)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage.

special.name: Frightful Cackle (Hyena or Vampire Form Only)
special.text: The vampire emits a bone-chilling cackle. Each creature of the vampire's choice that is within 120 feet of the vampire and can hear its cackle must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the vampire's Frightful Cackle for the next 24 hours.

special.name: Sickening Gaze (Hyena or Vampire Form Only)
special.text: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic or be poisoned for 24 hours. A creature whose saving throw is successful is immune to this vampire's Sickening Gaze for 24 hours.

multiAttack.text: The gnoll makes two Abyssal Strike attacks.

attacks.name: Abyssal Strike
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: 20 (5d6 + 3) Poison damage.

special.name: Hunger of Yeenoghu
special.text: The gnoll conjures a 30-foot Cube of magical Darkness originating from a point it can see within 60 feet, which lasts for 1 minute or until the gnoll's Concentration ends on it. This area is Difficult Terrain. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, any creature that starts its turn in this area or enters it for the first time on a turn. Failure: 28 (8d6) Necrotic damage, and the gnoll or a creature of its choice it can see gains 10 Temporary Hit Points. Success: Half damage only.

bonusActions.name: Rampage (2/Day)
bonusActions.text: Immediately after dealing damage to a creature that is already Bloodied, the gnoll moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Abyssal Strike attack.

traits.name: Death Link
traits.text: If its specter rider is reduced to 0 hit points, the gloamwing is destroyed.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The gloamwing doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.text: While in sunlight, the gloamwing has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

multiAttack.text: The gloamwing makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage.

multiAttack.text: The githyanki makes three Silver Sword attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Telekinesis if available.

attacks.name: Silver Sword
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) Psychic damage. Critical Hit: If the target is in an astral body (as with the Astral Projection spell), the githyanki can cut the silvery cord that tethers the target to its material body instead of dealing damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The githyanki casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): At will: Mage Hand (the hand is Invisible) 2/day each: Nondetection (self only), Tongues 1/day each: Plane Shift, Telekinesis

bonusActions.name: Misty Step (2/Day)
bonusActions.text: The githyanki casts Misty Step, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. 2 times per day: Misty Step

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The githyanki casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

traits.name: Sunlight Vulnerability
traits.text: While in sunlight, the snake has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. When the snake begins its turn in sunlight, it immediately suffers 10 radiant damage.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.text: If damage reduces the snake to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the snake drops to 1 hit point instead.

multiAttack.text: The snake makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with a constrict attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained and the snake cannot constrict another target.

multiAttack.text: The giant makes two attacks, using Frost Axe or Great Bow in any combination.

attacks.name: Frost Axe
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 10 ft. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) Slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) Cold damage.

attacks.name: Great Bow
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Cold damage, and the target's Speed decreases by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

bonusActions.name: War Cry
bonusActions.text: The giant or one creature of its choice that can see or hear it gains 16 (2d10 + 5) Temporary Hit Points and has Advantage on attack rolls until the start of the giant's next turn.

traits.name: Disarming Charm
traits.text: While Forge isn't wearing armor, his AC includes his Charisma modifier.

traits.name: Double-Cross
traits.text: If Forge hits a creature friendly to him with an attack roll, the attack is automatically a critical hit.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.text: If Forge is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails, provided he isn't incapacitated.

multiAttack.text: Forge makes two Dagger attacks, two Heavy Crossbow attacks, or one of each.

attacks.name: Dagger
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 24 (7d6) poison damage, and the target is poisoned until the end of its next turn.

attacks.name: Heavy Crossbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 24 (7d6) poison damage. Hit or Miss: If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of Forge's next turn.

bonusActions.name: Cunning
bonusActions.text: Forge takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action, or he gives himself advantage on the next attack roll he makes before the end of this turn.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.text: Forge halves the damage he takes from an attack that hits him. He must be able to see the attacker.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.text: If the Forest Master fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The Forest Master has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Master of Beasts
traits.text: The Forest Master can comprehend and communicate with any Beast, even if the Beast knows no languages.

multiAttack.text: The Forest Master makes either two Hooves attacks, two Moon Bolt attacks, or one of each.

attacks.name: Hooves
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Moon Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) radiant damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The Forest Master casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: druidcraft, fog cloud, guidance 2/day each: goodberry, greater restoration, pass without trace, speak with plants

bonusActions.name: Erupting Briars
bonusActions.text: The Forest Master touches his horn to the earth and causes a 5-foot-tall wall of briars to erupt in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. When the wall appears, each creature in its area is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space adjacent to the wall and must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Misty Escape
reactions.text: If the Forest Master takes damage from a melee attack, he, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, teleports to an unoccupied space within 30 feet that he can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Forest Master casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

multiAttack.text: The fomorian makes two Stone Club attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Warping Hex if available.

attacks.name: Stone Club
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach 15 ft. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Warping Hex
special.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature the fomorian can see within 120 feet. Failure: 21 (6d6) Psychic damage, and the target gains 1 Exhaustion level. Success: Half damage only.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.text: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

multiAttack.text: The troll makes six attacks: one with its bite and five with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

name: Fiendish Flesh Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

immunities.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine or silvered

traits.name: Berserk
traits.text: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 100 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points. If the golem's creator is within 60 feet of the berserk golem, the creator can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 100 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.text: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: The golem makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

multiAttack.text: The cultist makes three Pact Axe attacks.

attacks.name: Pact Axe
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) Slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) Fire damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks): At will: Scorching Ray (level 5 version), Thaumaturgy 2 times per day: Fireball (level 6 version)

reactions.name: Hellish Rebuke
reactions.text: The cultist casts Hellish Rebuke in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. At will: Hellish Rebuke

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks):

traits.name: Death Curse
traits.text: When the fensir starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate, it releases a curse on those around it. Each creature within 30 feet of the fensir when it dies must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or be cursed for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: The fensir regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it isn't in sunlight. If the fensir takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the fensir's next turn. The fensir dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.text: When the fensir starts its turn in sunlight, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the petrified condition until the fensir is no longer in sunlight.

multiAttack.text: The fensir makes two attacks, using Rend, Boulder, or a combination of them.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Boulder
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition. After the fensir throws the boulder, roll a d6; on a roll of 4 or lower, the fensir has no more boulders to throw.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The eyedrake doesn't require food or drink.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage.

special.name: Antimagic Breath
special.text: The eyedrake emits a magic wave in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 39 (6d12) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Every spell of 3rd level or lower ends on creatures and objects of the eyedrake's choice in that area.

special.name: Eye Rays
special.description: The eyedrake shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), each ray targeting one creature it can see within 60 feet of it:

options.name: 1: Freezing Ray
options.text: The target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 17 (5d6) cold damage, and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage with no additional effects.

options.name: 2: Debilitating Ray
options.text: The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) thunder damage and become incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

options.name: 3: Repulsion Ray
options.text: The target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or take 14 (4d6) force damage and be pushed up to 60 feet away from the eyedrake.

options.name: 4: Fire Ray
options.text: The target must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

options.name: 5: Paralyzing Ray
options.text: The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

options.name: 6: Death Ray
options.text: The target must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

special.text: The eyedrake shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), each ray targeting one creature it can see within 60 feet of it:

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The ceremorph has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The ceremorph makes one Slam attack and one Tentacles attack. The ceremorph can replace one of the attacks with a Mind Bolt attack, if available.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

attacks.name: Tentacles
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14) and must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or have the stunned condition until this grapple ends.

attacks.name: Extract Brain
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated Humanoid grappled by the ceremorph. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the ceremorph kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

attacks.name: Mind Bolt (3/Day)
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or have the stunned condition until the end of its next turn.

multiAttack.text: The cultist makes three attacks, using Elemental Flail or Elemental Claw in any combination.

attacks.name: Elemental Flail

components.damageOptions: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder

attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) damage of a type chosen by the cultist: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

attacks.name: Elemental Claw

components.damageOptions: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder

attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range 120 ft. Hit: 22 (4d10) damage of a type chosen by the cultist: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the cultist moves the target up to 10 feet straight toward or away from itself.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: Elementalism, Mage Hand

reactions.name: Elemental Absorption (1/Day)

components.trigger: The cultist takes Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage.

reactions.text: Trigger: The cultist takes Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage. The cultist gives itself Resistance to that instance of damage and gains 10 Temporary Hit Points.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
traits.text: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The dragonborn makes three Longsword attacks.

attacks.name: Longsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) radiant damage. The dragonborn can cause the sword to flare with bright light, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of the dragonborn's next turn. The sword can flare in this way only once per turn.

special.name: Healing Touch (1/Day)
special.text: The dragonborn touches another creature within 5 feet of it. The target magically regains 40 hit points. In addition, all diseases and poisons affecting the target are removed.

special.name: Radiant Breath
special.text: The dragonborn exhales fiery radiance in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When the dragonborn uses this action, it can choose up to three creatures in the cone. These creatures take no damage from the radiance and instead regain 22 (4d10) hit points each.

multiAttack.text: The diviner makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

attacks.name: Arcane Burst
attacks.text: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) radiant damage.

special.name: Overwhelming Revelation
special.text: The diviner magically creates a burst of illumination in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (10d8) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of the diviner's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The diviner casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: mage hand, message, prestidigitation 2/day each: arcane eye, detect magic, detect thoughts, fly, lightning bolt, locate object, mage armor, Rary's telepathic bond 1/day each: true seeing

reactions.name: Portent (3/Day)
reactions.text: When the diviner or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the diviner rolls a d20 and chooses whether to use that roll in place of the d20 rolled for the attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The diviner casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.text: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

multiAttack.text: The spider makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger; or the spider can make one attack with its web spinner followed by a melee attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 27 (6d8) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. If this poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

attacks.name: Stinger
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

attacks.name: Web Spinner
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 40 ft., one target. Hit: The target is pulled 40 feet toward the spider and is grappled (escape DC 14). The spider can grapple only one creature at a time in this way. As an action, the spider can cocoon a creature it has grappled in webbing, causing it to be restrained and ending the grappled condition.

reactions.name: Arterial Spray
reactions.text: When the spider takes damage while below half its hit point maximum, it can spray poisonous blood in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 13 (3d8) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. If this poison damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the creature is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.text: The decaton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Combat Ready
traits.text: The decaton has advantage on initiative rolls.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.text: If the decaton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

multiAttack.text: The decaton makes three Tentacle attacks.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the decaton can't use this tentacle against other targets. The decaton has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

special.name: Lightning Rays
special.text: The decaton unleashes a barrage of lightning bolts from its eyes. Each creature within 30 feet of the decaton must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 38 (7d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The decaton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action) 1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The decaton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

name: Deathlock Mastermind
languages: the languages it knew in life

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede the deathlock's darkvision.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.text: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The deathlock makes two Deathly Claw or Grave Bolt attacks.

attacks.name: Deathly Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3 necrotic damage).

attacks.name: Grave Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or become restrained as shadowy tendrils wrap around it for 1 minute. A restrained target can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, minor illusion 1/day each: darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, fly, invisibility

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

multiAttack.text: The cultist makes three attacks, using Dread Scythe or Deathly Ray in any combination.

attacks.name: Dread Scythe
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) Necrotic damage, and the target can't regain Hit Points until the end of its next turn.

attacks.name: Deathly Ray
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range 120 ft. Hit: 22 (4d10) Necrotic damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): At will: Speak with Dead, Thaumaturgy

bonusActions.name: Spirit Wail
bonusActions.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the cultist. Failure: 14 (4d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

multiAttack.text: The avatar makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

attacks.name: Hooves
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (8d6 + 4) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Horn
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (8d6 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be transformed into a wolf under the avatar's control. This transformation lasts for 1 hour, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The target's game statistics are replaced by the wolf's statistics, but it retains its hit points. The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its wolf form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech. The target's gear melds into the new form, and it can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

traits.name: Corpses
traits.text: When first encountered, a corpse flower contains the corpses of 1d6 + 3 Humanoids. A corpse flower can hold the remains of up to nine Humanoids. These remains have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the corpse flower. If the corpse flower dies, the corpses within it can be pulled free.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.text: The corpse flower can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Stench of Death
traits.text: Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the corpse flower or one of its zombies must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, unless the creature is a Construct or an Undead. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Stench of Death of all corpse flowers for 24 hours.

multiAttack.text: The corpse flower makes three Tentacle attacks.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

special.name: Harvest the Dead
special.text: The corpse flower swallows one unsecured Humanoid corpse within 10 feet of it, along with any equipment the corpse is wearing or carrying.

bonusActions.name: Digest
bonusActions.text: The corpse flower digests one corpse in its body and instantly regains 11 (2d10) hit points. Nothing of the digested corpse remains. Any equipment on the corpse is expelled from the corpse flower in its space.

bonusActions.name: Reanimate
bonusActions.text: The corpse flower animates one corpse in its body, turning it into a zombie. The zombie appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse flower and acts immediately after it in the initiative order. The zombie acts as an ally of the corpse flower but isn't under its control, and the flower's stench clings to it (see Stench of Death).

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The cockatrice doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

multiAttack.text: The cockatrice makes one Petrifying Bite attack and two Talons attacks.

attacks.name: Petrifying Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14. First Failure: The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.

attacks.name: Talons
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

reactions.name: Magical Backlash

components.trigger: A creature within 120 feet of the cockatrice deals damage to it.

reactions.text: Trigger: A creature within 120 feet of the cockatrice deals damage to it. Response—Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, the triggering creature. Failure: 13 (3d6 + 3) Force damage.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.text: While in Bright Light, the cloaker has Disadvantage on attack rolls.

multiAttack.text: The cloaker makes one Attach attack and two Tail attacks.

attacks.name: Attach
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 5 ft. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the cloaker attaches to it. While the cloaker is attached, the target has the Blinded condition, and the cloaker can't make Attach attacks against other targets. In addition, the cloaker halves the damage it takes (round down), and the target takes the same amount of damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 10 ft. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Slashing damage.

bonusActions.name: Moan
bonusActions.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 60-foot Emanation originating from the cloaker. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the end of the cloaker's next turn. Success: The target is immune to this cloaker's Moan for the next 24 hours.

bonusActions.name: Phantasms (Recharge after a Short or Long Rest)
bonusActions.text: The cloaker casts the Mirror Image spell, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability. The spell ends early if the cloaker starts or ends its turn in Bright Light. At will: Mirror Image

traits.name: Searing Presence
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the elemental takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

traits.name: Molten Form
traits.text: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage and must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be restrained. A creature that starts its turn restrained in this way takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, freeing itself on a success.

traits.name: Water Susceptibility
traits.text: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

multiAttack.text: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d10) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

attacks.name: Molten Gaze
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or have one nonmagical item of the elemental's choice that the target is carrying instantly melt or burn to cinders.

traits.name: Diabolical Restoration
traits.text: If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The devil makes two Chain attacks and uses Conjure Infernal Chain.

attacks.name: Chain
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 14) from one of two chains, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

special.name: Conjure Infernal Chain
special.text: The devil conjures a fiery chain to bind a creature. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature the devil can see within 60 feet. Failure: 9 (2d4 + 4) Fire damage, and the target has the Restrained condition until the end of the devil's next turn, at which point the chain disappears. If the target is Large or smaller, the devil moves the target up to 30 feet straight toward itself. Success: The chain disappears.

reactions.name: Unnerving Gaze

components.trigger: A creature the devil can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the devil and can see the devil.
components.failureEffect: The target has the Frightened condition until the end of its turn. The target is immune to this devil's Unnerving Gaze for 24 hours.

reactions.text: Trigger: A creature the devil can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the devil and can see the devil. Response—Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, the triggering creature. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the end of its turn. Success: The target is immune to this devil's Unnerving Gaze for 24 hours.

traits.name: Dimensional Lock
traits.text: Other creatures can't teleport to or from a space within 60 feet of the canoloth. Any attempt to do so is wasted.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The canoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Uncanny Senses
traits.text: The canoloth can't be surprised unless it's incapacitated.

multiAttack.text: The canoloth makes one Bite or Tongue attack and one Claw attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) force damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

attacks.name: Tongue
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 15), pulled up to 30 feet toward the canoloth, and restrained until the grapple ends. The canoloth can grapple one target at a time with its tongue.

multiAttack.text: The bone roc makes one Beak attack and two Talons attacks.

attacks.name: Beak
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Talons
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

name: Blood Drinker Vampire
languages: the languages it knew in life

multiAttack.text: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be charmed by the vampire for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the target is infatuated with the vampire. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

attacks.name: Rapier
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Unarmed Strike
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. The vampire can also grapple the target (escape DC 14) if it is a creature and the vampire has a hand free.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.text: The vampire adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the vampire must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

multiAttack.text: The blackguard makes three attacks, using Glaive, Shortbow, or both.

attacks.name: Glaive
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Shortbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

special.name: Dreadful Aspect (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special.text: Each enemy within 30 feet of the blackguard must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the blackguard for 1 minute. If a frightened target ends its turn more than 30 feet away from the blackguard, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The blackguard casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): 2/day each: command, dispel magic, find steed

bonusActions.name: Smite
bonusActions.text: Immediately after the blackguard hits a target with an attack roll, the blackguard can force that target to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target suffers one of the following effects of the blackguard's choice:

bonusActions.name: Blind
bonusActions.text: The target is blinded for 1 minute. The blinded target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonusActions.name: Shove
bonusActions.text: The target is pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The blackguard casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.text: The xorn can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the xorn doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.text: The xorn has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

traits.name: Treasure Sense
traits.text: The xorn can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 60 feet of it.

multiAttack.text: The xorn makes three claw attacks and one bite attack.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (5d6 + 5) piercing damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Bloodied Frenzy
traits.text: While Bloodied, the berserker has Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

multiAttack.text: The berserker makes three attacks, using Greataxe or Javelin in any combination.

attacks.name: Greataxe
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) Slashing damage, plus 10 (3d6) Thunder damage to the target or another creature within 5 feet of the target.

attacks.name: Javelin
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) Piercing damage, and the target's Speed decreases by 5 feet until the start of the berserker's next turn.

bonusActions.name: Frenzied Rush
bonusActions.text: Each ally within 30 feet of the berserker can take a Reaction to move up to half the ally's Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. The berserker can also move up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The elf has advantage on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the charmed condition on itself, and magic can't put it to sleep.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: The elf wears a suit of elven chain.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The elf doesn't require sleep.

multiAttack.text: The elf makes two Scimitar attacks and uses Radiant Beam (if available).

attacks.name: Scimitar
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) radiant damage.

special.name: Radiant Beam (3/Day)
special.text: A magical beam of radiance flashes out from the elf's hand in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The elf casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability: 1/day each: fly, mislead, sending

bonusActions.name: Starlight Step (3/Day)
bonusActions.text: The elf magically teleports up to 30 feet, along with anything it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see.

bonusActions.name: Summon Solar Dragon (1/Day)
bonusActions.text: The elf has a 50 percent chance of magically summoning a young solar dragon. A summoned dragon appears in an unoccupied space that the summoner can see, acts on its own initiative count, and is an ally of its summoner. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The elf casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

traits.name: Evasion
traits.text: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

multiAttack.text: The assassin makes three attacks, using Shortsword or Light Crossbow in any combination.

attacks.name: Shortsword
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 17 (5d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the assassin's next turn.

attacks.name: Light Crossbow
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range 80/320 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Piercing damage plus 21 (6d6) Poison damage.

bonusActions.name: Cunning Action
bonusActions.text: The assassin takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

name: Ashen Heir Assassin
languages: Thieves' cant plus any two languages

traits.name: Assassinate
traits.text: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.text: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.text: The assassin deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't incapacitated and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

multiAttack.text: The assassin makes two shortsword attacks.

attacks.name: Shortsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

attacks.name: Light Crossbow
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.text: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.text: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Reactive Heads
traits.text: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.text: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

multiAttack.text: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must make on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The reverser has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The reverser makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 6 (1d12) force damage.

attacks.name: Claws
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

reactions.name: Reversal
reactions.text: When a creature the reverser can see within 30 feet of it regains hit points, the reverser reduces the number of hit points regained to 0, and the reverser deals 13 (3d8) force damage to the creature.

traits.name: Aberrant Form
traits.text: The zealot exudes the chaos of the Far Realm. Any non-Aberration creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the zealot must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Weirdly Pliable
traits.text: The zealot, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is unnaturally flexible. The zealot can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

multiAttack.text: The zealot makes one Psychic Rend attack and two Shortsword attacks.

attacks.name: Psychic Rend
attacks.text: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have the stunned condition until the start of the zealot's next turn.

attacks.name: Shortsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

special.name: Mind Blast
special.text: The zealot magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the stunned condition on itself on a success.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The zealot casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: detect thoughts, minor illusion 1/day each: arcane gate, hunger of Hadar

bonusActions.name: Void Warp
bonusActions.text: The zealot teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself, leaving a churning void in the space it left. Immediately after it teleports, each creature within 30 feet of the void other than the zealot must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) force damage and is pulled to the unoccupied space closest to the void. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. The void then disappears.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The zealot casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Aberrant Form
traits.text: The zealot exudes the chaos of the Far Realm. Any non-Aberration creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the zealot must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Weirdly Pliable
traits.text: The zealot, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is unnaturally flexible. The zealot can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

multiAttack.text: The zealot makes one Psychic Rend attack and two Shortsword attacks.

attacks.name: Psychic Rend
attacks.text: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have the stunned condition until the start of the zealot's next turn.

attacks.name: Shortsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The zealot casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: detect thoughts, minor illusion 1/day each: arcane gate, hunger of Hadar

bonusActions.name: Void Warp
bonusActions.text: The zealot teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself, leaving a churning void in the space it left. Immediately after it teleports, each creature within 30 feet of the void other than the zealot must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) force damage and is pulled to the unoccupied space closest to the void. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. The void then disappears.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The zealot casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

multiAttack.text: The cultist makes two Tentacle Lash attacks. It can replace any attack with a use of Mind Rot.

attacks.name: Tentacle Lash
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) Psychic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 14) from one of two tentacles, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

special.name: Mind Rot
special.text: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature the cultist can see within 90 feet. Failure: 27 (6d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the cultist's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: Detect Thoughts, Minor Illusion

reactions.name: Counterspell (2/Day)
reactions.text: The cultist casts Counterspell in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. 2 times per day: Counterspell

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The yuan-ti has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: The yuan-ti makes two Bite attacks, and it can use Spellcasting to cast Suggestion if available.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Poison damage.

special.name: Constrict
special.text: Strength Saving Throw: DC 15, one Large or smaller creature within 5 feet. Failure: 28 (7d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. The target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 14), and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends. Success: Half damage only.

special.name: Poison Spray
special.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: 21 (6d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of the yuan-ti's next turn. While Poisoned, the target has the Blinded condition. Success: Half damage only.

special.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
special.text: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: Animal Friendship (snakes only) 3 times per day: Suggestion

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.text: The yuan-ti shape-shifts into a Large snake or returns to its true form. If it dies, it stays in its current form. The yuan-ti's game statistics are the same in each form, except where noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
headerEntries: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

special.name: Desiccating Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales yellowish necrotic energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 28 (8d6) necrotic damage and is weakened until the end of its next turn. A weakened creature has disadvantage on Strength-based ability checks and Strength saving throws, and the creature's weapon attacks that rely on Strength deal half damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't weakened.

special.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
special.text: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): 1/day each: bane, create or destroy water

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.text: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The dragon doesn't require air.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

special.name: Cold Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales a blast of frost in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 27 (6d8) cold damage, and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

bonusActions.name: Phase (2/Day)
bonusActions.text: The dragon becomes partially incorporeal for as long as it maintains concentration on the effect (as if concentrating on a spell). While partially incorporeal, the dragon has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Slowing Breath.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Slashing damage.

special.name: Acid Breath
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 40-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. Failure: 40 (9d8) Acid damage. Success: Half damage.

special.name: Slowing Breath
special.text: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: The target can't take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 10 ft. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Acid damage.

special.name: Acid Breath
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. Failure: 49 (14d6) Acid damage. Success: Half damage.

traits.name: Cavities
traits.text: The yggdrasti has 1d4 + 2 cavities in its trunk. Each cavity is big enough to hold one Medium creature, two Small creatures, or eight Tiny creatures. A creature inside a cavity has three-quarters cover against attacks and other effects that originate outside the cavity. The yggdrasti's cavities aren't connected to one another.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: If the yggdrasti is motionless and rooted in the ground at the start of combat, it looks just like a dead tree and has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the rooted yggdrasti move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the yggdrasti is animate.

traits.name: Lightning Conduit
traits.text: If the yggdrasti is subjected to lightning damage, it is unhurt, and the lightning damage is instead divided evenly among all creatures it is grappling. In addition, the yggdrasti regains one use of Lightning Discharge.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The yggdrasti doesn't require air or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The yggdrasti makes two Root attacks and uses Lightning Discharge (if available).

attacks.name: Root
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). The yggdrasti has four roots, each of which can grapple one target.

special.name: Lightning Discharge (3/Day)
special.text: The yggdrasti shoots lightning at one creature within 120 feet of itself. The target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.text: The wood elf has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the wood elf to sleep.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: The wood elf's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: dancing lights 1/day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.text: The wood elf is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The wood elf has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, poison spray, ray of frost 1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield, witch bolt 2nd level (3 slots): alter self, misty step, web 3rd level (3 slots): fly, lightning bolt 4th level (3 slots): Evard's black tentacles, greater invisibility 5th level (2 slots): cloudkill

attacks.name: Staff
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

special.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
special.text: The wood elf magically summons a quasit, or attempts to summon a shadow demon with a chance of success. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wood elf's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wood elf is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The wood elf has the following wizard spells prepared:

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: If the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing is motionless (except for its lure) at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing move or act (except for the lure), that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing is animate.

multiAttack.text: The wolf-in-sheep's-clothing makes one Bite attack and two Root Tentacle attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

attacks.name: Root Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 16). While grappled in this way, the target has the restrained condition, and at the start of each of the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing's turns, the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing can pull the target up to 10 feet toward itself (no action required). The wolf-in-sheep's-clothing has four root tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

bonusActions.name: Completely Harmless Lure
bonusActions.text: The wolf-in-sheep's-clothing can change the color, texture, and shape of its lure to resemble a Tiny Beast or Tiny object. It can move the lure to reinforce the resemblance (no action required), but the lure must remain within 15 feet of the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing, connected by nearly invisible filament-like tendrils.

traits.name: Antimagic Cone
traits.text: The woe strider's open mouth creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 60-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the woe strider decides which way the cone faces and whether its mouth is open or closed.

multiAttack.text: The woe strider makes two claw attacks and one bite attack. If both claws hit the same creature, the target is grappled (escape DC 14).

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is grappled, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage. In addition, each magic item the creature is carrying that isn't an artifact has its magical properties suppressed for 1 minute.

multiAttack.text: The professor makes two Verdant Lash attacks.

attacks.name: Verdant Lash
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet closer to the professor.

special.name: Summon Nature's Avatar (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
special.text: The professor magically summons a Groff. The groff appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the professor, acts as the professor's ally, and takes its turns immediately after the professor's. The professor can communicate telepathically with this groff while it remains. The groff remains for 10 minutes, until it or the professor dies, or until the professor dismisses it as an action.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability: At will: druidcraft, spare the dying 1/day each: greater restoration, lesser restoration, mass cure wounds, pass without trace, plant growth, revivify

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

traits.name: Essence Transfer (1/Day)
traits.text: The professor can cast the animate dead spell, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

multiAttack.text: The professor makes two Mortality Spear attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Mortality Spear
attacks.text: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the professor's next turn.

special.name: Essence Pulse
special.text: The professor creates a life-draining vortex in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature of the professor's choice that it can see within that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 23 (5d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The professor then regains 10 hit points. An affected creature's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The creature dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: druidcraft, spare the dying 1/day each: antilife shell, bane, feign death, speak with dead

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.text: If the chandelier is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the chandelier move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the chandelier is animate.

traits.name: Fiery Aura
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the chandelier takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

multiAttack.text: The chandelier makes three Chain attacks, three Lamp attacks, or a combination thereof.

attacks.name: Chain
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the chandelier.

attacks.name: Lamp
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) fire damage.

special.name: Blazing Vortex
special.text: Each creature within 20 feet of the chandelier and not behind total cover must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 36 (8d8) fire damage and have the blinded condition until the start of the chandelier's next turn.

name: Water Elemental Myrmidon
languages: one language of its creator's choice

multiAttack.text: The myrmidon makes three Trident attacks.

attacks.name: Trident
attacks.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) force damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) force damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

special.name: Freezing Strikes
special.text: The myrmidon uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 5 (1d10) cold damage. A target that is hit by one or more of these attacks has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of the myrmidon's next turn.

name: Warlock of the Fiend
languages: any two languages (usually Abyssal or Infernal)

traits.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.text: When the warlock makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a d10 to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

multiAttack.text: The warlock makes three Scimitar attacks.

attacks.name: Scimitar
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

special.name: Hellfire
special.text: Green flame explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of the warlock. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage and 11 (2d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At will: alter self, mage armor (self only), mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation 1/day each: banishment, plane shift, suggestion

reactions.name: Fiendish Rebuke (3/Day)
reactions.text: In response to being damaged by a visible creature within 60 feet of it, the warlock forces that creature to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
